English: Now it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David had returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had stayed two days in Ziklag
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Sôl lôch, Đawit blah lu bơngai Amalek jei sư đang boih, na sư brŏk oei lăm pơlei Siklak 'bar năr.

English: on the third day, behold, it happened that a man came from Saul’s camp with his clothes torn and dust on his head. So it was, when he came to David, that he fell to the ground and prostrated himself.
Bahnar: Năr mă pêng đei minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng kơđông Sôl, hơbĕn ao sư hiah đĭ, kơ̆l sư 'bĕnh kơ 'mui teh sư năm 'bơ̆t anăp drap kơkuh kơ Đawit.

English: And David said to him, “Where have you come from?” So he said to him, “I have escaped from the camp of Israel.”
Bahnar: Đawit jet sư: “Ih đơ̆ng yơ?” Sư tơl: “Inh đơ̆ng kơđông linh Isơrael kơdâu hlôi tơ âu.”

English: Then David said to him, “How did the matter go? Please tell me.” And he answered, “The people have fled from the battle, many of the people are fallen and dead, and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also.”
Bahnar: Đawit jet dơ̆ng: “Đei tơdrong kiơ tơ noh? Ih roi kơ inh.” Sư roi: “Lu bơngai Isơrael tơblah thuơ kơdâu đĭ boih, đei lơ bơngai lôch; Sôl păng kon sư Jônathan, kư̆m lôch mơ̆n.”

English: So David said to the young man who told him, “How do you know that Saul and Jonathan his son are dead?”
Bahnar: Đawit jet bơngai tơdăm mă roi ei: “Liơ ih băt kơ Sôl păng kon sư Jônathan lôch boih?”

English: Then the young man who told him said, “As I happened by chance to be on Mount Gilboa, there was Saul, leaning on his spear; and indeed the chariots and horsemen followed hard after him.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơdăm ei tơl: “Lăp inh năm rok trong kông Gilbôa,” na inh 'bôh Sôl oei 'bĭch hơgrop hăm tơju sư, gre hăm lu linh ayăt druh wă jê̆ sư.

English: Now when he looked behind him, he saw me and called to me. And I answered, ‘Here I am.’
Bahnar: Na sư hue lăng 'bôh inh păng krao inh. Inh tơl: “Kiơ inh tơ âu.”

English: And he said to me, ‘Who are you?’ So I answered him, ‘I am an Amalekite.’
Bahnar: Sư jet inh; “ih bu? Inh tơl:” Inh bơngai Amalek.

English: He said to me again, ‘Please stand over me and kill me, for anguish has come upon me, but my life still remains in me.’
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ inh: Năm tơ âu jah pơlôch inh đĕch, yua kơ inh pơnĕ pơmat ưh kơ jah lôch.

English: So I stood over him and killed him, because I was sure that he could not live after he had fallen. And I took the crown that was on his head and the bracelet that was on his arm, and have brought them here to my lord.”
Bahnar: Na inh năm jê̆ pơlôch sư hloi, yua kơ inh băt kơ sư ưh pă gơh arih boih, yua kơ rơka jrŭ dêh, na inh plôh iŏk môk pơtao đơ̆ng kơ̆l sư hăm kong maih đơ̆ng kơkŏng ti sư, na chĕp ba tơ âu ăn kơ ih yŏng inh.

English: Therefore David took hold of his own clothes and tore them, and so did all the men who were with him.
Bahnar: Đawit hek hloi ao sư, đĭ-đăng lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư kư̆m pơm thoi noh.

English: And they mourned and wept and fasted until evening for Saul and for Jonathan his son, for the people of the LORD and for the house of Israel, because they had fallen by the sword.
Bahnar: Lu sư tŭr kơtơh, nhơ̆m hmoi, hăm ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa truh tơ kơsơ̆, wă wang ơh sơ'ngon kơ Sôl hăm kon sư Jônathan, hăm yua kơ kon pơlei Kră Yang păng adrĕch Isơrael, yua kơ lu bơngai 'nâu pơ̆k lôch lăm anih tơblah.

English: Then David said to the young man who told him, “Where are you from?” And he answered, “I am the son of an alien, an Amalekite.”
Bahnar: Đawit jet bơngai tơdăm noh: “Ih bơngai đơ̆ng yơ? Sư tơl:” Inh kon tơdăm bơngai Amalek, oei tơ âu.

English: So David said to him, “How was it you were not afraid to put forth your hand to destroy the LORD’s anointed?”
Bahnar: Đawit ôr: “Yua kơ kiơ ih pơ̆n pơlôch bơngai mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang rơih.”

English: Then David called one of the young men and said, “Go near, and execute him!” And he struck him so that he died.
Bahnar: Đawit krao minh 'nu bơngai tơdăm kiơ̆ sư na khan: “Năm pơlôch sư bĕ!” Bơngai ei năm pơlôch sư hloi.

English: So David said to him, “Your blood is on your own head, for your own mouth has testified against you, saying, ‘I have killed the LORD’s anointed.’ ”
Bahnar: Đawit khan: “Pham ih tuh plơ̆ kơpal kơ̆l ih! Nơ̆r ih roi kơdih tơdrong noh, yua kơ ih khan: ‘Kơdih inh pơlôch bơngai mă Kră Yang rơih.’ ”

English: Then David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son
Bahnar: Đawit pơm 'bai hơri nhơ̆m hmoi ơh sơ'ngon kơ Sôl păng kon tơdăm sư Jônathan.

English: and he told them to teach the children of Judah the Song of the Bow; indeed it is written in the Book of Jasher
Bahnar: Đawit bơtho tơ'blŏk kơ lu kon pơlei bơngai Juđa 'bai hơri hơ'ngon gah Hră jŭk, mă đe gô chih răk lăm sơ̆p hla bơar roi gah Bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt (Jashar)

English: “The beauty of Israel is slain on your high places! How the mighty have fallen!
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai mă iĕm ư-ang, ơ Isơrael Đĭ lôch hiong lăm kông kŏ! Ôi lu bơngai nuih kơtang 'nâu lôch boih.

English: Tell it not in Gath, Proclaim it not in the streets of Ashkelon— Lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, Lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ chă roi tơdrong 'nâu tơ lăm pơlei Gat, 'nĕ chă roi tơdrong noh kiơ̆ trong tih pơlei Askalon; kơnh lu bơngai drŏ-kăn Philistin hiĕk chhôk, lu drŏ-kăn bơngai ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar hiôk chơt.

English: “O mountains of Gilboa, Let there be no dew nor rain upon you, Nor fields of offerings. For the shield of the mighty is cast away there! The shield of Saul, not anointed with oil.
Bahnar: Ơ kông groi Gilbôa Rŏ kơ tŭk gom păng 'mi 'nĕ pă jruh tơ ih, rŏ kơ ưh pă đei chŭn mir, teh mơ̆r 'lơ̆ng tơ anih 'nâu dơ̆ng. Yua kơ tơ anih noh khêl đao tơblah lu bơngai nuih kơtang jing đĭ 'mê̆-'mach, Khêl đao Sôl ưh pă layơ wă sŭt pơiel hăm đak rơmă dơ̆ng.

English: From the blood of the slain, From the fat of the mighty, The bow of Jonathan did not turn back, And the sword of Saul did not return empty.
Bahnar: Hră jŭk Jônathan ưh kơ đei layơ wơ̆t brŏk, khan huay kơ đei pham bơngai lôch klep, Đao Sôl ưh kơ layơ brŏk hoh. Mă-lei layơ kư̆m đei rơmă lu bơngai nuih kơtang klep.

English: “Saul and Jonathan were beloved and pleasant in their lives, And in their death they were not divided; They were swifter than eagles, They were stronger than lions.
Bahnar: Ôi pơtao Sôl hăm Jônathan trŏ kơ 'mêm gĭt tơpă! Mă oei arih truh tơ lôch kư̆m ưh kơ đei achăng băl: Măr sư hơbĕch hloh kơ Klang pran hloh kơ Dăm-brang!

English: “O daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, Who clothed you in scarlet, with luxury; Who put ornaments of gold on your apparel.
Bahnar: Ơ lu drŏ-kăn Isơrael, nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ 'mêm kơ Sôl. Sư pơhrŭk ăn kơ iĕm ao che thêt 'lơ̆ng, Pơhrôp pơguăng chô̆ ăn maih tơ ao lu iĕm.

English: “How the mighty have fallen in the midst of the battle! Jonathan was slain in your high places.
Bahnar: Ôi hĭ bơngai nuih kơtang âu pơ̆k tơ anih tơblah. Jônathan lôch tơ anih groi grôn.

English: I am distressed for you, my brother Jonathan; You have been very pleasant to me; Your love to me was wonderful, Surpassing the love of women.
Bahnar: Ơ Jônathan, 'nhŏng inh, jơhngơ̆m inh ơh hang nuih kơ ih thoi đe 'bet; Inh 'mêm kơeng kơ ih dêh. Tơdrong buăl juăt ba hiôk hơiă dêh Hloh kơ tơdrong hưch wă kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn.

English: “How the mighty have fallen, And the weapons of war perished!”
Bahnar: “Ôi hĭ bơngai nuih kơtang đĭ pơ̆k lôch! Tơmam tơblah đĭ pơchah răm.”

English: It happened after this that David inquired of the LORD, saying, “Shall I go up to any of the cities of Judah?” And the LORD said to him, “Go up.” David said, “Where shall I go up?” And He said, “To Hebron.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh, Đawit krao apinh Kră Yang: Inh hăm gơh năm tơ minh pôm pơlei ayơ lăm dêh Juđa ưh? Kră Yang tơl sư: Năm bĕ. Đawit apinh dơ̆ng: Inh gô năm tơ yơ? Kră Yang tơl: Ih năm tơ Hêbrôn.

English: So David went up there, and his two wives also, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail the widow of Nabal the Carmelite.
Bahnar: Đawit tŏk năm tơ noh hơdai hăm 'bar 'nu akăn sư, Ahinôam đơ̆ng pơlei Jêsreel hăm Abigail, dơ̆ng akăn Nabal pơlei Karmel.

English: And David brought up the men who were with him, every man with his household. So they dwelt in the cities of Hebron.
Bahnar: Đawit kư̆m chông ba lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư năm hăm hnam dơnŏ lu sư, năm mơ̆n na chă oei tơ lu pơlei lăm tơring Hêbrôn.

English: Then the men of Judah came, and there they anointed David king over the house of Judah. And they told David, saying, “The men of Jabesh Gilead were the ones who buried Saul.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđa năm truh tơ Hêbrôn tơ noh na lu sư tuh đak rơmă kơ Đawit pôk sư pơm pơtao bơngai Juđa. Đe năm roi ăn kơ Đawit: “Kon pơlei Jabes Gileat 'bŭ hơmet Sôl.”

English: So David sent messengers to the men of Jabesh Gilead, and said to them, “You are blessed of the LORD, for you have shown this kindness to your lord, to Saul, and have buried him.
Bahnar: Đawit wơh bơngai năm ngôi hơpong tơ pơlei Jabes lăm tơring Gileat, na khan: “Hơpơi apinh Kră Yang tuh ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu iĕm, yua kơ lu iĕm pôm đon hăm Sôl yŏng lu iĕm, na iĕm 'bŭ hơmet sư!

English: And now may the LORD show kindness and truth to you. I also will repay you this kindness, because you have done this thing.
Bahnar: Dang ei apinh Kră Yang iŏk tơdrong sĭt 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Sư ăn kơ lu iĕm, gah inh kư̆m bơnê păng pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ lu iĕm, yua kơ lu iĕm đei pơm boih tơdrong noh

English: Now therefore, let your hands be strengthened, and be valiant; for your master Saul is dead, and also the house of Judah has anointed me king over them.”
Bahnar: Hơpơi kơ lu iĕm đei jơhngơ̆m nuih kơtang khŏm tơ'bôh ăn kơ đe iĕm jing bơngai nuih kơtang, yua kơ Sôl yŏng iĕm đĭ lôch boih; păng lu bơngai Juđa đei tuh đak rơmă pôk inh pơm pơtao lu sư.”

English: But Abner the son of Ner, commander of Saul’s army, took Ishbosheth the son of Saul and brought him over to Mahanaim
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Apner, kon drŏ-nglo Nêr yŏng linh Sôl ba Isbôset,a kon tơdăm Sôl, ôn tơ pơlei Mahanaim

English: and he made him king over Gilead, over the Ashurites, over Jezreel, over Ephraim, over Benjamin, and over all Israel.
Bahnar: Apner pôk Isbôset pơm pơtao tơring Gileat, kon pơlei Asuri, tơring Jêsreel, Êphraim, Bênjamin, păng đĭ char Isơrael.

English: Ishbosheth, Saul’s son, was forty years old when he began to reign over Israel, and he reigned two years. Only the house of Judah followed David.
Bahnar: Kơplah Isbôset, kon tơdăm Sôl pơtơm pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r Isơrael, sư đei puăn-jĭt sơnăm, sư pơgơ̆r lăm 'bar sơnăm; lăp lu adrĕch Juđa đĕch kiơ̆ Đawit.

English: And the time that David was king in Hebron over the house of Judah was seven years and six months.
Bahnar: Đawit oei tơ pơlei Hêbrôn pơgơ̆r lu adrĕch Juđa đei tơpơh sơnăm tơdrâu khei.

English: Now Abner the son of Ner, and the servants of Ishbosheth the son of Saul, went out from Mahanaim to Gibeon.
Bahnar: Lăp Apner, kon tơdăm Nêr, hăm lu đĭch đam Isbôset, kon tơdăm Sôl lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Mahanaim lĕch năm tơ Gibeôn

English: And Joab the son of Zeruiah, and the servants of David, went out and met them by the pool of Gibeon. So they sat down, one on one side of the pool and the other on the other side of the pool.
Bahnar: Jôap kon tơdăm Sêruia, păng lu đĭch đam Đawit kư̆m dai lĕch; 'bar pah tơ'bơ̆p băl 'bơ̆t dơnâu Gibeôn, na minh khŭl oei pah âu, hăm minh khŭl oei pah to kơ đak dơnâu.

English: Then Abner said to Joab, “Let the young men now arise and compete before us.” And Joab said, “Let them arise.”
Bahnar: Apner khan kơ Jôap: “ ‘Bơ̆n lê̆ lu bơngai tơdăm 'nâu iung pơlong băl lăng 'bơ̆t anăp bơ̆n.’ Jôap khan: ‘Lei bĕ lê̆ lu sư pơlong băl.’ ”

English: So they arose and went over by number, twelve from Benjamin, followers of Ishbosheth the son of Saul, and twelve from the servants of David.
Bahnar: Na lu sư iung năm hloi, 'bar pah dôm ăi, gah Isbôset, kon tơdăm Sôl, bơngai Bênjamin mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai tơdăm, păng gah Đawit mơjĭt-'bar 'nu tơdăm bơngai Juđa.

English: And each one grasped his opponent by the head and thrust his sword in his opponent’s side; so they fell down together. Therefore that place was called the Field of Sharp Swords, which is in Gibeon.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu rôp kơ̆l bơngai mă ayăt, iŏk đao 'bet tơ rơhiĕo, na đĭ-đăng lu sư kư̆m lôch hơdai. Đe krao anih noh anăn Hêlkat Hasurim,b lăm tơmăn glă Gibeôn.

English: So there was a very fierce battle that day, and Abner and the men of Israel were beaten before the servants of David.
Bahnar: Lăm minh năr noh tơdrong tơblah băl krưp dêh. Apner hăm lu bơngai Isơrael lu sư thuơ kơ lu linh pơtao Đawit.

English: Now the three sons of Zeruiah were there: Joab and Abishai and Asahel. And Asahel was as fleet of foot as a wild gazelle.
Bahnar: Tơ noh kư̆m đei pêng 'nu kon tơdăm Sêruia: Noh Jôap, Abisai păng Asahel, Asahel 'nâu sư kơdâu hơbĕch hơbal nhen thoi Keh.

English: So Asahel pursued Abner, and in going he did not turn to the right hand or to the left from following Abner.
Bahnar: Sư kơdâu druh 'moi Apner, ưh kơ weh kơ sư, mă khan tơ gah 'ma dah tơ gah 'ngiĕo.

English: Then Abner looked behind him and said, “Are you Asahel?” He answered, “I am.”
Bahnar: Apner hue tơ rŏng păng apinh khan: “Hăm trŏ kơ ih Asahel ưh? Sư tơl trŏ boih inh âu.”

English: And Abner said to him, “Turn aside to your right hand or to your left, and lay hold on one of the young men and take his armor for yourself.” But Asahel would not turn aside from following him.
Bahnar: Apner khan kơ sư: “Weh bĕ gah 'ma dah gah 'ngiĕo năm rôp minh 'nu bơngai tơdăm, na iŏk hloi tơmam tơblah đao đơ̆ng sư,” mă-lei Asahel ưh kơ wă weh đơ̆ng druh Apner.

English: So Abner said again to Asahel, “Turn aside from following me. Why should I strike you to the ground? How then could I face your brother Joab?”
Bahnar: Apner khan dơ̆ng kơ Asahel: Athei weh bĕ đơ̆ng inh, yua kơ kiơ ih wă kơ inh pơlôch ih 'bơ̆t dâu? Lei liơ inh gơh lăng muh măt 'nhŏng ih Jôap

English: However, he refused to turn aside. Therefore Abner struck him in the stomach with the blunt end of the spear, so that the spear came out of his back; and he fell down there and died on the spot. So it was that as many as came to the place where Asahel fell down and died, stood still.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Asahel ưh kơ wă weh na Apner iŏk hloi tơju wih rŏng 'bet hloi 'bơ̆t klak klĕch tơ kơdŭ rŏng Asahel pơ̆k lôch kơtă anih. Đĭ-đăng bơngai truh tơ anih Asahel lôch, lu sư dơ̆ng đĭ tơ anih noh.

English: Joab and Abishai also pursued Abner. And the sun was going down when they came to the hill of Ammah, which is before Giah by the road to the Wilderness of Gibeon.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Jôap hăm Abisai druh Apner; kơplah măr sư truh tơ groi Amma jê̆ pơlei Giah, 'bơ̆t trong năm tơ tơmăn glă Gibeôn, na 'năr đĭ mơ̆t.

English: Now the children of Benjamin gathered together behind Abner and became a unit, and took their stand on top of a hill.
Bahnar: Lu linh bơngai Bênjamin akŭm băl kơjăp tăp dăr kơ Apner; na lu sư dơ̆ng tơ kơpal groi.

English: Then Abner called to Joab and said, “Shall the sword devour forever? Do you not know that it will be bitter in the latter end? How long will it be then until you tell the people to return from pursuing their brethren?”
Bahnar: Apner ôr krao Jôap khan: Liơ lê̆ đao hrăn tơ'bet băl hă? E kư̆m băt mơ̆n tuch-luch jing pơmat-tat ngăl đĕch leh kiơ?

English: And Joab said, “As God lives, unless you had spoken, surely then by morning all the people would have given up pursuing their brethren.”
Bahnar: Jôap tơl: Inh pơkă 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Arih ling-lang, tơdah ih ưh kơ pơma lei linh wă druh lu iĕm dĭng truh tơ dơning mă pơdơh.

English: So Joab blew a trumpet; and all the people stood still and did not pursue Israel anymore, nor did they fight anymore.
Bahnar: Jôap athei đe hlôm keng, đĭ-đăng linh athei pơdơh, ưh pă druh lu kon pơlei Isơrael, păng ưh pă tơblah băl dơ̆ng.

English: Then Abner and his men went on all that night through the plain, crossed over the Jordan, and went through all Bithron; and they came to Mahanaim.
Bahnar: Apner hăm lu linh kiơ̆ sư yak prăt măng noh năm rok teh dơnă, tŏk hlôi kơ Krong Jôrđăn tơ jơ̆p kơ Bitrôn, dĭng truh tơ pơlei Mahanaim.

English: So Joab returned from pursuing Abner. And when he had gathered all the people together, there were missing of David’s servants nineteen men and Asahel.
Bahnar: Jôap ưh pă druh Apner, na akŭm pơgơ̆p đĭ lu linh wă lăng 'bôh lăm lu đĭch đam Đawit, ưh kơ 'bôh mơjĭt-tơsĭn 'nu akŭm hăm Asahel.

English: But the servants of David had struck down, of Benjamin and Abner’s men, three hundred and sixty men who died.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu linh Đawit đei pơlôch pêng-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt 'nu lu bơngai Bênjamin lu linh kiơ̆ jơ̆ng Apner.

English: Then they took up Asahel and buried him in his father’s tomb, which was in Bethlehem. And Joab and his men went all night, and they came to Hebron at daybreak.
Bahnar: Lu sư tung akâu Asahel, 'bŭ hơdai hăm 'bă sư tơ pơlei Betlehem. Đơ̆ng noh, Jôap hăm lu linh kiơ̆ jơ̆ng sư năm prăt măng dĭng 'brưch pơgê truh tơ pơlei Hêbrôn.

English: Now there was a long war between the house of Saul and the house of David. But David grew stronger and stronger, and the house of Saul grew weaker and weaker.
Bahnar: Đei tơdrong tơblah đunh tơpă khŭl Đawit hăm khŭl Sôl, gah khŭl Đawit rai đunh rai pran, na gah khŭl Sôl rai đunh rai rơdu tơrăn.

English: Sons were born to David in Hebron: His firstborn was Amnon by Ahinoam the Jezreelitess
Bahnar: Tơ Hêbrôn lu akăn Đawit pơjing kon drŏ-nglo ăn kơ pơtao Đawit; kon kơdră sư anăn Amnôn đơ̆ng Ahinôam bơngai Jêsreel tơpŭ ăn.

English: his second, Chileab, by Abigail the widow of Nabal the Carmelite; the third, Absalom the son of Maacah, the daughter of Talmai, king of Geshur
Bahnar: Kon mă 'bar sư Kilêap, đơ̆ng Abigail đêl akăn Nabal bơngai Karmel tơpŭ. Kon mă pêng anăn Apsalôm kon drŏ-nglo Maka kon adruh Thamai, pơtao Gêsur.

English: the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith; the fifth, Shephatiah the son of Abital
Bahnar: Kon mă puăn Adonija, đơ̆ng yă Hagit, kon drŏ-nglo mă pơđăm anăn Sephatia, kon kă Abitan

English: and the sixth, Ithream, by David’s wife Eglah. These were born to David in Hebron.
Bahnar: păng kon drŏ-nglo mă tơdrâu anăn Itrêam, đơ̆ng yă Egla akăn Đawit. 'Nâu lu kon drŏ-nglo mă Đawit pơjing kơplah sư oei tơ pơlei Hêbrôn.

English: Now it was so, while there was war between the house of Saul and the house of David, that Abner was strengthening his hold on the house of Saul.
Bahnar: Lăm kơplah khŭl Sôl hăm khŭl Đawit oei tơblah băl, na Apner dŏng gah Sôl.

English: And Saul had a concubine, whose name was Rizpah, the daughter of Aiah. So Ishbosheth said to Abner, “Why have you gone in to my father’s concubine?”
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôl đei minh 'nu akăn kơnhŏng, anăn sư Ripba, kon adruh Aiyah. Isbôset kon drŏ-nglo pơtao Sôl chrih kơ Apner khan: Yua kơ kiơ ih năm tơ akăn kơnhŏng 'bă inh?

English: Then Abner became very angry at the words of Ishbosheth, and said, “Am I a dog’s head that belongs to Judah? Today I show loyalty to the house of Saul your father, to his brothers, and to his friends, and have not delivered you into the hand of David; and you charge me today with a fault concerning this woman?
Bahnar: Apner blĕk hil dêh yua kơ Isbôset pơma, na khan: “Inh âu thoi kŏ kơ bơngai Juđa dah liơ?” Inh oei đĭ jơhngơ̆m kiơ̆ gah khŭl Sôl 'bă ih; 'nhŏng oh, buăl juăt pơtao Sôl truh tơ dang ei. Inh kư̆m ưh kơ wă jao pơtao Sôl lăm ti Đawit, na dang ei pơtao pơma chrih kơ inh khan glăi hăm bơngai drŏ-kăn 'nâu!

English: May God do so to Abner, and more also, if I do not do for David as the LORD has sworn to him
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang phak Apner mă trăp, tơdah inh ưh kơ kiơ̆ Đawit pơkeh dôm tơdrong Kră Yang đei pơkă hăm sư.

English: to transfer the kingdom from the house of Saul, and set up the throne of David over Israel and over Judah, from Dan to Beersheba.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei pơkă khan wă iŏk lê̆ tơdrong pơgơ̆r teh đak đơ̆ng pơtao Sôl, ăn kơ Đawit pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r Isơrael păng Juđa, iŏk đơ̆ng pơlei Đan truh tơ Bêrsêba.

English: And he could not answer Abner another word, because he feared him.
Bahnar: Isbôset ưh kơ pơ̆n tơl minh nơ̆r hăm Apner yua hli kơ sư.

English: Then Abner sent messengers on his behalf to David, saying, “Whose is the land?” saying also, “Make your covenant with me, and indeed my hand shall be with you to bring all Israel to you.”
Bahnar: Apner wơh hloi bơngai năm roi truh tơ Đawit khan dêh char bu âu? Ih athei pơkă pơgơ̆p hăm inh, na inh gô tơgŭm chông ba pơđĭ kon pơlei Isơrael brŏk tơ ih.

English: And David said, “Good, I will make a covenant with you. But one thing I require of you: you shall not see my face unless you first bring Michal, Saul’s daughter, when you come to see my face.”
Bahnar: Đawit tơl: “Ơ, inh gô pơkă pơgơ̆p hăm ih. Inh apinh ih minh tơdrong: Ih ưh kơ gơh năm tơ'bơ̆p inh, ăp kơ ih chông ba Mikal, kon adruh Sôl 'mơ̆i, tơdah ih wă năm tơ'bơ̆p inh.”

English: So David sent messengers to Ishbosheth, Saul’s son, saying, “Give me my wife Michal, whom I betrothed to myself for a hundred foreskins of the Philistines.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit wơh hloi bơngai năm tơ Isbôset kon tơdăm Sôl na khan: Apinh ih pơdrâu Mikal akăn inh mă inh đei oei hăm minh-hrĕng tŏ kơ̆l tơmam drŏ-nglo Philistin.

English: And Ishbosheth sent and took her from her husband, from Paltiel the son of Laish.
Bahnar: Na Isbôset wơh bơngai năm iŏk drŏ-kăn noh đơ̆ng hnam klo sư, Phatiêl, kon drŏ-nglo Lais.

English: Then her husband went along with her to Bahurim, weeping behind her. So Abner said to him, “Go, return!” And he returned.
Bahnar: Klo sư năm ba yak rah nhơ̆m rah kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng ba truh tơ Bahurim, na Apner khan kơ sư: “Ih brŏk bĕ,” na sư brŏk brăi.

English: Now Abner had communicated with the elders of Israel, saying, “In time past you were seeking for David to be king over you.
Bahnar: Apner pơma dơnuh lê̆ adrol hăm lu kră bơngai Isơrael: “Đơ̆ng sơ̆ lu iĕm hơpơi wă kơ Đawit pơm pơtao.

English: Now then, do it! For the LORD has spoken of David, saying, ‘By the hand of My servant David, I will save My people Israel from the hand of the Philistines and the hand of all their enemies.’ ”
Bahnar: Na dang ei iĕm athei pơm bĕ; yua kơ Kră Yang đei pơkă hăm Đawit: ‘Inh gô yua Đawit đĭch đam Inh gô dŏng pơklaih adrĕch Isơrael Inh đơ̆ng tơpang ti bơngai Philistin păng đơ̆ng dôm lu bơngai ayăt nai.’ ”

English: And Abner also spoke in the hearing of Benjamin. Then Abner also went to speak in the hearing of David in Hebron all that seemed good to Israel and the whole house of Benjamin.
Bahnar: Apner kư̆m pơma pơđâu thoi noh hăm lu adrĕch Bênjamin; na sư năm tơ Hêbrôn roi tơbăt ăn kơ Đawit dôm tơdrong mă lu bơngai Isơrael hăm lu bơngai Bênjamin hơpơi.

English: So Abner and twenty men with him came to David at Hebron. And David made a feast for Abner and the men who were with him.
Bahnar: Kơplah Apner năm roi kơ Đawit tơ Hêbrôn, sư chông ba 'bar-jĭt 'nu bơngai, na Đawit hơmet tơmam et sa ăn kơ Apner hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư.

English: Then Abner said to David, “I will arise and go, and gather all Israel to my lord the king, that they may make a covenant with you, and that you may reign over all that your heart desires.” So David sent Abner away, and he went in peace.
Bahnar: Đang kơ et sa Apner pơma dơnuh hăm Đawit khan: “Inh gô akŭm pơđĭ lu bơngai Isơrael năm ba brŏk tơ pơtao, lu sư gô pơgơ̆p pơkă pơkăm hăm ih, na ih pơm yŏng pơtao pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng kơ dêh char Isơrael, thoi kơ ih đei hơpơi.” Đawit ăn kơ Apner brŏk na sư brŏk hiôk-hian.

English: At that moment the servants of David and Joab came from a raid and brought much spoil with them. But Abner was not with David in Hebron, for he had sent him away, and he had gone in peace.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Jôap hăm lu linh Đawit 'nao brŏk đơ̆ng tơblah lu bơngai ayăt, đei chĕp ba lơ tơmam đêl blah iŏk. Kơplah noh Apner ưh pă hơdai hăm Đawit tơ Hêbrôn, yua kơ Đawit đĭ ăn kơ sư brŏk boih, na sư brŏk hiôk-hian.

English: When Joab and all the troops that were with him had come, they told Joab, saying, “Abner the son of Ner came to the king, and he sent him away, and he has gone in peace.”
Bahnar: Lăp Jôap hăm đĭ-đăng lu linh sư brŏk truh boih, Jôap kơtơ̆ng khan: Apner kon tơdăm Nêr đei năm pơma dơnuh hăm pơtao, pơtao ăn kơ sư brŏk, na lu sư lĕch brŏk hiôk-hian.

English: Then Joab came to the king and said, “What have you done? Look, Abner came to you; why is it that you sent him away, and he has already gone?
Bahnar: Jôap năm tơ pơtao na khan: “Pơtao ih pơm kiơ thoi noh? Apner năm tơ'bơ̆p ih, liơ mă ih ăn kơ sư brŏk na sư brŏk hloi boih?

English: Surely you realize that Abner the son of Ner came to deceive you, to know your going out and your coming in, and to know all that you are doing.”
Bahnar: Pơtao ih băt hloh Apner, kon tơdăm Nêr, sư năm wă hơlĕnh pơdăr kơ ih, wă kơ băt trong ih yak năm, hăm wă kơ chă băt dôm tơdrong jang pơtao pơm.”

English: And when Joab had gone from David’s presence, he sent messengers after Abner, who brought him back from the well of Sirah. But David did not know it.
Bahnar: Đang kơ pơma hăm Đawit Jôap weh, wơh hloi bơngai druh 'moi Apner wă kơ tam druh tam tơ đak sơlŭng Sira, lu sư pơtơm Apner brŏk hơlơ̆k, sơmă Đawit ưh kơ băt.

English: Now when Abner had returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside in the gate to speak with him privately, and there stabbed him in the stomach, so that he died for the blood of Asahel his brother.
Bahnar: Lăp Apner brŏk hơlơ̆k truh tơ Hêbrôn, Jôap chông hơdrô̆ Apner weh tơ cheng kơ 'măng dur pơlei, nhen thoi wă pơma dơnuh tơdrong tơduă măr sư, wă 'mong pham đêl Apner pơlôch oh sư Asahel, na 'bet hloi klak, na Apner lôch hloi.

English: Afterward, when David heard it, he said, “My kingdom and I are guiltless before the LORD forever of the blood of Abner the son of Ner.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Đawit băt boih, na sư khan: “Inh hăm dêh char pơtao inh ưh kơ đei layơ yoch 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang kơ pham Apner, kon tơdăm Nêr.

English: Let it rest on the head of Joab and on all his father’s house; and let there never fail to be in the house of Joab one who has a discharge or is a leper, who leans on a staff or falls by the sword, or who lacks bread.”
Bahnar: Thŭ pham Apner noh tuh tơ kơpal kơ̆l Jôap hăm đĭ-đăng adrĕch 'bă sư păng adrĕch sư ưh kơ đei bu huay kơ đei jĭ krơ, jĭ chin, jopo, mơ'nah lôch kơ đao, mơ'nah tơmam sa ưh mah”

English: So Joab and Abishai his brother killed Abner, because he had killed their brother Asahel at Gibeon in the battle.
Bahnar: Jôap hăm Abisai 'nhŏng sư, pơlôch Apner, yua kơ Apner pơlôch Asahel, oh măr sư, năr tơblah tơ Gibeôn.

English: Then David said to Joab and to all the people who were with him, “Tear your clothes, gird yourselves with sackcloth, and mourn for Abner.” And King David followed the coffin.
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ Jôap hăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei kiơ̆ sư tơ noh: “Hek bĕ ao, asu 'bi tơ akâu, na nhơ̆m hmoi kơ Apner;” lu bơngai năm 'bŭ yak adrol kơ hơbang tung Apner, Đawit kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng kơ đe tung Apner.

English: So they buried Abner in Hebron; and the king lifted up his voice and wept at the grave of Abner, and all the people wept.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư 'bŭ Apner đang boih tơ Hêbrôn, na pơtao nhơ̆m hmoi ôr 'bơ̆t bơsat Apner; đĭ-đăng kon pơlei kư̆m wang nhơ̆m hmoi.

English: And the king sang a lament over Abner and said: “Should Abner die as a fool dies?
Bahnar: Pơtao hmoi jô̆ hơdrĭ kơ Apner: “Liơ Apner ih lôch thoi bơngai kơhlôh kơwao.

English: Your hands were not bound Nor your feet put into fetters; As a man falls before wicked men, so you fell.” Then all the people wept over him again.
Bahnar: Ti ih ưh kơ đei chô̆, jơ̆ng ih kư̆m ưh kơ đei hơnuh. Ih pơ̆k lôch thoi kơ bơngai pơ̆k lôch 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai chă pơlôch kư̆ kă.” Na đĭ-đăng bơngai nhơ̆m hmoi kơ sư dơ̆ng.

English: And when all the people came to persuade David to eat food while it was still day, David took an oath, saying, “God do so to me, and more also, if I taste bread or anything else till the sun goes down!”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đĭ-đăng lu sư năm jê̆ tơ Đawit, pơlung pơlŭt sư sa 'biơ̆ 'bĕng tŏ sĕt adrol kơ 'năr mơ̆t. Mă-lei Đawit pơkăm khan: “Tơdah adrol kơ 'năr mơ̆t inh đei sa minh pôm 'bĕng dah tơmam sa kiơ nai, apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei phak inh mă trăp.”

English: Now all the people took note of it, and it pleased them, since whatever the king did pleased all the people.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei wang drơ̆ng na lăp đon kơ tơdrong noh, kư̆m thoi lu sư ngăl juăt kơ lăp đon dôm tơdrong kiơ pơtao pơm.

English: For all the people and all Israel understood that day that it had not been the king’s intent to kill Abner the son of Ner.
Bahnar: Lăm 'năr noh kon pơlei Isơrael băt kơ pơtao ưh kơ đei athei đe pơlôch Apner, kon tơdăm Nêr.

English: Then the king said to his servants, “Do you not know that a prince and a great man has fallen this day in Israel?
Bahnar: Pơtao khan kơ lu đĭch đam sư: “Lu iĕm ưh kơ băt ôh hă 'năr 'nâu, minh 'nu bơngai pơm tih minh 'nu bơngai yŏng mơng lăm lu bơngai Isơrael lôch boih.

English: And I am weak today, though anointed king; and these men, the sons of Zeruiah, are too harsh for me. The LORD shall repay the evildoer according to his wickedness.”
Bahnar: Mă inh 'nâu đei tuh đak rơmă pôk pơm pơtao, mă-lei inh 'bôh inh rơdu tơrăn pơting hăm lu bơngai 'nâu, lu kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia; lu sư pơm kơtang hloh kơ inh Apinh Kră Yang pơm tơwih kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ 'nâu, kiơ̆ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư!”

English: When Saul’s son heard that Abner had died in Hebron, he lost heart, and all Israel was troubled.
Bahnar: Băt kơ Apner lôch boih tơ Hêbrôn, Isbôset kon drŏ-nglo pơtao Sôl jơhngơ̆m sư tơtơ̆ păng đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael rŭng răng hli tơrơ.

English: Now Saul’s son had two men who were captains of troops. The name of one was Baanah and the name of the other Rechab, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, of the children of Benjamin. (For Beeroth also was part of Benjamin
Bahnar: Pơtao Isbôset kon tơdăm Sôl đei 'bar 'nu yŏng linh, minh 'nu anăn Baanah, minh 'nu anăn Rêkap: Pơđĭ kơ bre sư kon tơdăm Rimmôn đơ̆ng pơlei Bêrôt adrĕch Bênjamin; yua kơ pơlei Bêrôt kư̆m jô̆ pơlei lăm tơring Bênjamin

English: because the Beerothites fled to Gittaim and have been sojourners there until this day.)
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Bêrôt kơdâu ôn đĭ tơ pơlei Gitaim, lu sư oei truh tơ dang ei.

English: Jonathan, Saul’s son, had a son who was lame in his feet. He was five years old when the news about Saul and Jonathan came from Jezreel; and his nurse took him up and fled. And it happened, as she made haste to flee, that he fell and became lame. His name was Mephibosheth.
Bahnar: Jônathan, kon tơdăm Sôl đei minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo hơwen 'bar pah jơ̆ng. Lăp gơ̆p roi tơbăt Jônathan hăm Sôl lôch tơ Jêsreel, kơplah noh sư đĭ pơđăm sơnăm boih, bơngai rong tơmŏm sư pôk anhăk sư kơdâu ôn; kơplah sư kơdâu hăt hot sư huŏng đơ̆ng ti na jing jo. Anăn sư Mêphibôset.

English: Then the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, Rechab and Baanah, set out and came at about the heat of the day to the house of Ishbosheth, who was lying on his bed at noon.
Bahnar: 'Bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Rimmôn đơ̆ng pơlei Bêrôt, noh Rêkap hăm Baanah kơplah tŏk-bŏk 'năr tŏ. Năm truh tơ hnam Isbôset, sư oei tep pơdơh 'năr dơ̆ng.

English: And they came there, all the way into the house, as though to get wheat, and they stabbed him in the stomach. Then Rechab and Baanah his brother escaped.
Bahnar: Măr sư mơ̆t hloi lăm hnam, chă pơchĕ khan wă năm iŏk 'ba. Na 'bet hloi 'bơ̆t klak Isbôset. Đơ̆ng noh Rêkap hăm Baanah 'nhŏng sư kơdâu ôn.

English: For when they came into the house, he was lying on his bed in his bedroom; then they struck him and killed him, beheaded him and took his head, and were all night escaping through the plain.
Bahnar: Bre sư 'bet pơlôch boih pơtao Isbôset kơplah oei tep kơpal giơng lăm anih tep, chơ̆ng iŏk kơ̆l sư, chĕp ba na năm tơpăt trong dơnă Araba prăt măng.

English: And they brought the head of Ishbosheth to David at Hebron, and said to the king, “Here is the head of Ishbosheth, the son of Saul your enemy, who sought your life; and the LORD has avenged my lord the king this day of Saul and his descendants.”
Bahnar: Măr sư chĕp ba kơ̆l Isbôset brŏk tơ Hêbrôn, ăn kơ pơtao Đawit, na khan: “'Nâu kơ̆l Isbôset, kon tơdăm Sôl, bơngai mă ayăt kơ ih, bơngai mă oei chă wă pơrăm ih; năr 'nâu Kră Yang iung kơting ăn kơ ih pơm tơwih boih kơ Sôl păng adrĕch adrung sư.”

English: But David answered Rechab and Baanah his brother, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, and said to them, “As the LORD lives, who has redeemed my life from all adversity
Bahnar: Đawit tơl bre Rêkap hăm Baanah kon tơdăm Rimmôn pơlei Bêrôt: “Inh pao anăn Kră Yang mă arih ling-lang, Tơ'ngla dŏng inh đơ̆ng dôm tơdrong gleh truh

English: when someone told me, saying, ‘Look, Saul is dead,’ thinking to have brought good news, I arrested him and had him executed in Ziklag—the one who thought I would give him a reward for his news.
Bahnar: Kơplah bơngai năm roi ăn kơ inh khan, Sôl lôch boih, sư tơchĕng khan sư năm roi ăn tơdrong hiôk chơt. Inh athei đe rôp păng pơlôch sư tơ pơlei Siklak, noh inh apah kơ tơdrong sư roi.

English: How much more, when wicked men have killed a righteous person in his own house on his bed? Therefore, shall I not now require his blood at your hand and remove you from the earth?”
Bahnar: Pơma kơ kiơ kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ pơlôch bơngai 'lơ̆ng oei 'bĭch tep kơpal giơng lăm hnam sư kơdih! Inh wă apinh pham bơngai noh đơ̆ng ti măr iĕm păng inh gô pơlôch măr iĕm dang ei đơ̆ng teh âu.”

English: So David commanded his young men, and they executed them, cut off their hands and feet, and hanged them by the pool in Hebron. But they took the head of Ishbosheth and buried it in the tomb of Abner in Hebron.
Bahnar: Đawit athei hloi lu linh sư pơlôch 'bar 'nu bơngai noh, chơ̆ng jơ̆ng ti sư, na hơtol akâu sư jê̆ cheng đak dơnâu tơ Hêbrôn, mă-lei kơ̆l Isbôset lu linh 'bŭ lăm bơsat Apner, tơ Hêbrôn.

English: Then all the tribes of Israel came to David at Hebron and spoke, saying, “Indeed we are your bone and your flesh.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng adrĕch Isơrael năm tơ Đawit tơ Hêbrôn, na khan: “Lu nhôn 'nâu jing sĕch akar ih.

English: Also, in time past, when Saul was king over us, you were the one who led Israel out and brought them in; and the LORD said to you, ‘You shall shepherd My people Israel, and be ruler over Israel.’ ”
Bahnar: Adrol sơ̆ kơplah Sôl oei pơm pơtao, ih boih pơgơ̆r lu linh Isơrael năm tơblah. ‘Kră Yang đei khan kơ ih’ ‘Ih boih gô wei rong kon pơlei pơla Isơrael Inh, păng pơgơ̆r lu sư.”

English: Therefore all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and King David made a covenant with them at Hebron before the LORD. And they anointed David king over Israel.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kră bơngai Isơrael năm tơ pơtao Đawit tơ Hêbrôn; pơtao Đawit đei pơm tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm lu sư tơ Hêbrôn 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, na lu sư tuh đak rơmă pôk Đawit pơm pơtao Isơrael.

English: David was thirty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned forty years.
Bahnar: Kơplah Đawit pơm pơtao, sư 'nao pêng-jĭt sơnăm păng sư pơgơ̆r lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm.

English: In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years over all Israel and Judah.
Bahnar: Tơ Hêbrôn, Đawit pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Juđa tơpơh sơnăm tơdrâu khei, păng tơ Jêrusalem, sư pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng Isơrael păng Juđa pêng-jĭt pêng sơnăm.

English: And the king and his men went to Jerusalem against the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, who spoke to David, saying, “You shall not come in here; but the blind and the lame will repel you,” thinking, “David cannot come in here.”
Bahnar: Đawit wang blah pơlei Jêrusalem, lu bơngai Jêbus, oei tơ noh. Lu sư khan kơ Đawit: “Ih lê̆ kơ mơ̆t tơ âu, mă lu bơngai măt tol hăm jơ̆ng jo đĕch kư̆m gơh puh lê̆ ih.” Lu sư pơma noh wă khan: “Đawit ưh kơ layơ wă gơh mơ̆t tơ âu.”

English: Nevertheless David took the stronghold of Zion (that is, the City of David).
Bahnar: Mă-lei Đawit kư̆m blah iŏk kơđông Siôn, đe krao plei Đawit.

English: Now David said on that day, “Whoever climbs up by way of the water shaft and defeats the Jebusites (the lame and the blind, who are hated by David’s soul), he shall be chief and captain.” Therefore they say, “The blind and the lame shall not come into the house.”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Đawit khan: “Dah bơngai bu wă blah bơngai Jêbus, athei mơ̆t rok trong đing đak, blah lu bơngai jơ̆ng jo măt tol lu bơngai mă ayăt hăm Đawit.” Đei nơ̆r khan: “Lu bơngai măt tol jơ̆ng jo ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t tơ hnam pơtao âu.”

English: Then David dwelt in the stronghold, and called it the City of David. And David built all around from the Millo and inward.
Bahnar: Đawit oei lăm kơđông anăn kơđông pơlei Đawit. Sư man dur puăn pah đơ̆ng groi Milô năm tơ gah lăm.

English: So David went on and became great, and the LORD God of hosts was with him.
Bahnar: Đawit rai đunh rai pran kơtang yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh oei hơdai sư.

English: Then Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar trees, and carpenters and masons. And they built David a house.
Bahnar: Hiram pơtao pơlei Tirơ, wơh bơngai năm tơ Đawit, chĕp ba 'long hơngo, chông ba thơ̆ jang 'long, thơ̆ teh tơmo wă man hnam pơtao kơ Đawit.

English: So David knew that the LORD had established him as king over Israel, and that He had exalted His kingdom for the sake of His people Israel.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh pơtao Đawit băt boih kơ Kră Yang pôk sư pơm pơtao Isơrael, păng ăn kơ teh đak sư pơgơ̆r đe pơyom yua kơ đei lơi yua kơ kon pơlei Isơrael Sư.

English: And David took more concubines and wives from Jerusalem, after he had come from Hebron. Also more sons and daughters were born to David.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Đawit lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Hêbrôn năm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, sư chă lu akăn tơm păng akăn kơnhŏng dơ̆ng na đei pơjing ăn kơ sư lu kon drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn dơ̆ng.

English: Now these are the names of those who were born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu kon sư tơpŭ lăm pơlei Jêrusalem: Sammua, Sôbap, Nathan, Sôlômôn.

English: Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia
Bahnar: Iphar, Êlisua, Nêphek, Japhia

English: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.
Bahnar: Êlisama, Êliađa, păng Êliphêlet.

English: Now when the Philistines heard that they had anointed David king over Israel, all the Philistines went up to search for David. And David heard of it and went down to the stronghold.
Bahnar: Lăp bơngai Philistin băt kơ Đawit đei tuh rơmă pôk pơm pơtao Isơrael boih, na năm chă wă rôp Đawit. Đawit kơtơ̆ng băt tơdrong noh, jur năm ôn hloi tơ lăm kơđông.

English: The Philistines also went and deployed themselves in the Valley of Rephaim.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Philistin năm gă tơ lăm thŭng Rêphaim.

English: So David inquired of the LORD, saying, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? Will You deliver them into my hand?” And the LORD said to David, “Go up, for I will doubtless deliver the Philistines into your hand.”
Bahnar: Đawit krao apinh Kră Yang: “Inh hăm gơh năm blah bơngai Philistin ưh? Ih hăm jao lu sư lăm tơpang ti inh?” Kră Yang tơl: Năm bĕ yua kơ Inh jao boih lu sư lăm tơpang ti ih.

English: So David went to Baal Perazim, and David defeated them there; and he said, “The LORD has broken through my enemies before me, like a breakthrough of water.” Therefore he called the name of that place Baal Perazim.
Bahnar: Đawit năm tơ pơlei Baal Phêrasim, 'nâu mă anih tơblah jei sư. Đawit khan: “Kră Yang blah pơchah lu bơngai ayăt 'bơ̆t anăp inh, thoi đak blah pơchah bơnơ̆;” na sư anăn anih 'nâu pơlei Baal Phêrasim.

English: And they left their images there, and David and his men carried them away.
Bahnar: Bơngai Philistin kơdâu achăng lê̆ lu rup yang lu sư kơtă doh; Đawit hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư iŏk chĕp ba lu rup yang noh.

English: Then the Philistines went up once again and deployed themselves in the Valley of Rephaim.
Bahnar: Lu linh bơngai Philistin wơ̆t gă lăm thŭng Rêphaim dơ̆ng.

English: Therefore David inquired of the LORD, and He said, “You shall not go up; circle around behind them, and come upon them in front of the mulberry trees.
Bahnar: Đawit krao apinh Kră Yang, Sư tơl: “Ih 'nĕ kơ năm tơpăt, mă-lei athei năm wer đơ̆ng rŏng blah lu sư tơklă kơdrơ̆ng 'long hơngo bri.

English: And it shall be, when you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry trees, then you shall advance quickly. For then the LORD will go out before you to strike the camp of the Philistines.”
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t kơplah mă ih kơtơ̆ng jơ̆ng yak lăm kơdrơ̆ng 'long hơngo bri ih athei năm blah hloi, yua kơ 'bơ̆t kơplah noh Kră Yang năm adrol kơ ih blah lu linh Philistin.”

English: And David did so, as the LORD commanded him; and he drove back the Philistines from Geba as far as Gezer.
Bahnar: Đawit kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong Kră Yang bơtho pơkă kơ sư; sư blah druh bơngai Philistin đơ̆ng Gibeôn truh tơ Geser.

English: Again David gathered all the choice men of Israel, thirty thousand.
Bahnar: Đawit akŭm đĭ-đăng lu linh nuih kơtang đei rơih iŏk đơ̆ng lăm bơngai Isơrael. Pêng-jĭt rơbâu 'nu.

English: And David arose and went with all the people who were with him from Baale Judah to bring up from there the ark of God, whose name is called by the Name, the LORD of Hosts, who dwells between the cherubim.
Bahnar: Sư păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai kiơ̆ truh tơ pơlei Baala dêh Juđa wă năm tung iŏk Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; Hom noh kon pơlei krao anăn Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Kră Yang mă dan tang-dŏ Sư kơpal rim kơ chêrubim kơpal tơnglơ̆p Hom pơgơ̆p.

English: So they set the ark of God on a new cart, and brought it out of the house of Abinadab, which was on the hill; and Uzzah and Ahio, the sons of Abinadab, drove the new cart.
Bahnar: Lu sư tah Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơpal gre 'nao, iŏk đơ̆ng hnam Abinađap oei kơpal groi. Usa păng Ahiô, kon tơdăm Abinađap, chĕp gre 'nao noh.

English: And they brought it out of the house of Abinadab, which was on the hill, accompanying the ark of God; and Ahio went before the ark.
Bahnar: Usa năm rok cheng Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gah Ahiô năm adrol. Lu sư anhăk Hom pơgơ̆p đơ̆ng hnam Abinađap oei kơpal groi.

English: Then David and all the house of Israel played music before the LORD on all kinds of instruments of fir wood, on harps, on stringed instruments, on tambourines, on sistrums, and on cymbals.
Bahnar: Đawit hăm đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael hơri ư-ang 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang hăm dôm tơmam brŏ reh pơm păng 'long dơnơ̆ng, thoi brŏ tĭng-nĭng, hơgơ̆r iĕ chhar, huan lak.

English: And when they came to Nachon’s threshing floor, Uzzah put out his hand to the ark of God and took hold of it, for the oxen stumbled.
Bahnar: Lăp truh tơ cham pơjuă 'ba Nakôn, Usa chro ti rôp Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ rơmo kơtơih.

English: Then the anger of the LORD was aroused against Uzzah, and God struck him there for his error; and he died there by the ark of God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang hil dêh kơ Usa, yua kơ sư rôp pel 'bơm Hom pơgơ̆p noh; Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơlôch hloi sư 'bơ̆t anih 'noh 'bơ̆t cheng Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And David became angry because of the LORD’s outbreak against Uzzah; and he called the name of the place Perez Uzzah to this day.
Bahnar: Đawit sơ'ngon dêh, yua kơ Kră Yang pơlôch Usa, na sư krao anih 'noh Pêres-Usa, anăn 'nâu oei truh tơ dang ei.

English: David was afraid of the LORD that day; and he said, “How can the ark of the LORD come to me?”
Bahnar: Lăm năr 'noh, Đawit hli kơ Kră Yang na pơma khan: “Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei liơ mă inh pơ̆n iŏk lê̆ tơ inh âu?”

English: So David would not move the ark of the LORD with him into the City of David; but David took it aside into the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Đawit ưh kơ wă lê̆ Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang tơ hnam sư tơ pơlei Đawit, na athei anhăk ba hloi tơ hnam Ôbêt Eđôm, bơngai Gitit.

English: The ark of the LORD remained in the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite three months. And the LORD blessed Obed-Edom and all his household.
Bahnar: Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang oei pêng khei lăm hnam Ôbêt Eđôm, bơngai Gitit na Kră Yang tuh ăn pŭn hiôk kơ Ôbêt Eđôm păng đĭ hnam dơnŏ sư.

English: Now it was told King David, saying, “The LORD has blessed the house of Obed-Edom and all that belongs to him, because of the ark of God.” So David went and brought up the ark of God from the house of Obed-Edom to the City of David with gladness.
Bahnar: Đe năm roi ăn kơ pơtao Đawit: “Kră Yang đei tuh pŭn hiôk kơ hnam dơnŏ Ôbêt Eđôm păng dôm tơmam sư đei, yua kơ Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.” Đawit hloi năm iŏk anhăk hloi Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng hnam Ôbêt Eđôm ba tơ pơlei Đawit hăm tơdrong chơt hiôk dêh.

English: And so it was, when those bearing the ark of the LORD had gone six paces, that he sacrificed oxen and fatted sheep.
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai tung Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei năm tơdrâu yak na Đawit pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo tơno păng rơmo kon bek pơm tơmam soi.

English: Then David danced before the LORD with all his might; and David was wearing a linen ephod.
Bahnar: Wă hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang, Đawit iŏk hrŭk ao êphot, na suang đĭ jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk.

English: So David and all the house of Israel brought up the ark of the LORD with shouting and with the sound of the trumpet.
Bahnar: Kơplah Đawit păng đĭ kon pơlei Isơrael tung anhăk ba Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang nơ̆r jreo tơkĕch hiôk chơt păng hlôm keng.

English: Now as the ark of the LORD came into the City of David, Michal, Saul’s daughter, looked through a window and saw King David leaping and whirling before the LORD; and she despised him in her heart.
Bahnar: Lăp Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang mơ̆t tơ pơlei Đawit, na Mikal kon adruh Sôl, lăng tơmang đơ̆ng 'măng-'mŏk, 'bôh Đawit suang chơt hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, na sư đei jơhngơ̆m ưh kơ iă kơ Đawit.

English: So they brought the ark of the LORD, and set it in its place in the midst of the tabernacle that David had erected for it. Then David offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu sư ba Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang ming tơ anih bơsŭn Đawit đei hơmet lê̆ boih anih kơ Hom pơgơ̆p; đơ̆ng noh Đawit pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh pơkhôi kơ Kră Yang păng tơmam soi et sa chơt hiôk.

English: And when David had finished offering burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Kơplah Đawit pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh pơkhôi păng tơmam soi et sa chơt hiôk, na sư yua anăn Kră Yang Tih Hloh tuh ăn pŭn hiôk kơ kon pơlei

English: Then he distributed among all the people, among the whole multitude of Israel, both the women and the men, to everyone a loaf of bread, a piece of meat, and a cake of raisins. So all the people departed, everyone to his house.
Bahnar: Sư asong kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael, lu tơpôl lăm Isơrael mă drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn, minh 'nu minh pôm 'bĕng mi minh kơnăt 'nhĕm phang, hăm minh tơpei 'bĕng hơmu kro, đơ̆ng noh, đĭ-đăng lu sư brŏk tơ hnam sư kơdih.

English: Then David returned to bless his household. And Michal the daughter of Saul came out to meet David, and said, “How glorious was the king of Israel today, uncovering himself today in the eyes of the maids of his servants, as one of the base fellows shamelessly uncovers himself!”
Bahnar: Đawit kư̆m dai brŏk wă sơkat pŭn hiôk kơ hnam dơnŏ sư kơdih; mă-lei Mikal kon adruh Sôl, năm sơng Đawit, na khan: “Năr 'nâu pơtao đe Isơrael pơm kơdih akâu wă kơ đei ư-ang, mah suang akâu hoh 'bơ̆t anăp lu đam drŏ-kăn sư, pơm thoi bơngai ưh kơ rơ-a kiơ!”

English: So David said to Michal, “It was before the LORD, who chose me instead of your father and all his house, to appoint me ruler over the people of the LORD, over Israel. Therefore I will play music before the LORD.
Bahnar: Đawit tơl khan: “Inh suang wă ư-ang kơ Kră Yang Tơ'ngla mă rơih iŏk inh ưh kơ rơih 'bă ih păng đĭ kơ adrĕch sư, Sư pôk inh pơm pơtao kon pơlei Isơrael, jing kon pơlei Kră Yang, lei na inh suang chơt hiôk wă ư-ang kơ Kră Yang.”

English: And I will be even more undignified than this, and will be humble in my own sight. But as for the maidservants of whom you have spoken, by them I will be held in honor.”
Bahnar: Wă kơ đe lăng inh jing bơngai lŭch hloh; inh gô tơjur akâu inh hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng, mă lu bơngai drŏ-kăn awih awăn gô jing pôk pơyom kơ inh hloh.

English: Therefore Michal the daughter of Saul had no children to the day of her death.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Mikal; kon adruh Sôl, ưh kơ đei pơjing hơ'lơ̆p ôh truh tơ sư lôch.

English: Now it came to pass when the king was dwelling in his house, and the LORD had given him rest from all his enemies all around
Bahnar: Kơplah pơtao oei lăm hnam pơtao sư, păng Kră Yang ăn kơ sư pơdơh hiôk huay pă đei ayăt jum dăr kơ sư

English: that the king said to Nathan the prophet, “See now, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of God dwells inside tent curtains.”
Bahnar: na pơtao khan kơ Nathan bơngai khan lê̆ adrol: “Lăng deh inh oei lăm hnam pơm păng 'long hơngo, gah Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei lăm bơsŭn pơm hăm che.”

English: Then Nathan said to the king, “Go, do all that is in your heart, for the LORD is with you.”
Bahnar: Nathan tơl pơtao khan: “Pơm bĕ kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m ih tơchĕng, yua kơ Kră Yang oei hơdai ih.”

English: But it happened that night that the word of the LORD came to Nathan, saying
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm măng noh hloi, đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Nathan

English: “Go and tell My servant David, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Would you build a house for Me to dwell in?
Bahnar: “Athei năm khan kơ Đawit, đĭch đam Inh Kră Yang khan thoi âu” Ih wă pơm kơ Inh hnam oei hă?

English: For I have not dwelt in a house since the time that I brought the children of Israel up from Egypt, even to this day, but have moved about in a tent and in a tabernacle.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr Inh anhăk kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ truh tơ dang ei, Inh ưh kơ đei oei tơ lăm hnam ayơ, mă-lei kơplah chă năm tơ âu tơ noh Inh oei lăm bơsŭn đĕch.

English: Wherever I have moved about with all the children of Israel, have I ever spoken a word to anyone from the tribes of Israel, whom I commanded to shepherd My people Israel, saying, ‘Why have you not built Me a house of cedar?’ ” ’
Bahnar: Mă tơ anih ayơ Inh năm hăm kon pơlei Isơrael, Inh hăm đei layơ chă pơma chrih kơ lu bơngai mă Inh đei rơih wă wei-lăng kon pơlei Isơrael Inh: Liơ lu iĕm ưh kơ pơm kơ Inh minh pôm hnam hăm 'long hơngo?

English: Now therefore, thus shall you say to My servant David, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts: “I took you from the sheepfold, from following the sheep, to be ruler over My people, over Israel.
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei, ih athei roi kơ Đawit, đĭch đam Inh Kră Yang Tih Hloh đei khan thoi âu: “Inh boih đei krao ih đơ̆ng tơmăn 'nhĕt anih ih oei wei triu, pôk ih jing bơngai pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Inh.

English: And I have been with you wherever you have gone, and have cut off all your enemies from before you, and have made you a great name, like the name of the great men who are on the earth.
Bahnar: Inh đei oei hơdai hăm ih, lăm rim anih ih năm pơrăm lê̆ lu ayăt kơ ih đơ̆ng anăp ih; Inh gô ăn kơ anăn ih đe ư-ang tih kư̆m thoi anăn bơngai yŏng mơng lăm teh đak.

English: Moreover I will appoint a place for My people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in a place of their own and move no more; nor shall the sons of wickedness oppress them anymore, as previously
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael Inh minh anih oei, Inh gô ăn kơ sư chăt rơh lăm anih noh, ăn kơ lu sư oei kơjăp tơ anih noh, huay pă đei hli kơ kiơ dơ̆ng, păng lu bơngai kơnê̆ ưh pă gơh pơjuă pơđep thoi sơ̆ dơ̆ng.

English: since the time that I commanded judges to be over My people Israel, and have caused you to rest from all your enemies. Also the LORD tells you that He will make you a house.
Bahnar: Kơplah Inh pôk pơjing bơngai sek tơlang pơgơ̆r bơngai Isơrael Inh, Inh gô ăn kơ ih huay pă hli oei hiôk-hian ưh pă đei ayăt chă pơrăm ih dơ̆ng păng Kră Yang pơkă khan Sư gô tơiung pơdơ̆ng kơ ih minh pôm hnam.

English: “When your days are fulfilled and you rest with your fathers, I will set up your seed after you, who will come from your body, and I will establish his kingdom.
Bahnar: Lăp jơ 'năr ih đĭ boih, păng ih lôch năm oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok yă ih, na Inh gô pôk minh 'nu đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch adrung ih sư noh đơ̆ng kon ih pơjing wă pơtrơp kơ tang-dŏ pơtao ih, păng Inh gô ăn kơ dêh char pơtao sư kơjăp.

English: He shall build a house for My name, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom forever.
Bahnar: Sư noh kơnh gô pơm hnam kơ anăn Inh oei păng Inh gô ăn kơ tang-dŏ dêh char pơtao sư kơjăp ling-lang.

English: I will be his Father, and he shall be My son. If he commits iniquity, I will chasten him with the rod of men and with the blows of the sons of men.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm 'bă sư, sư gô jing kon Inh. Tơdah sư pơm yoch, tơpă Inh gô teh bơtho sư hăm sơnguĕt, thoi mĕ 'bă teh bơtho kon

English: But My mercy shall not depart from him, as I took it from Saul, whom I removed from before you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdrong 'mêm Inh ưh kơ weh đơ̆ng sư thoi Inh weh đơ̆ng Sôl, bơngai mă Inh achăng lê̆ wă pôk hơtŏk ih pơm pơtao.

English: And your house and your kingdom shall be established forever before you. Your throne shall be established forever.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Adrĕch hnam ih ưh kơ đei khăi bơngai pơtrơp ih; Inh gô ăn tang-dŏ ih kơjăp khŏm khŏm. Păng dêh char pơtao ih oei kơjăp ling-lang khŏm khŏm.”

English: According to all these words and according to all this vision, so Nathan spoke to David.
Bahnar: Nathan bơngai khan lê̆ adrol năm roi ăn kơ Đawit dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang pơma lăm tơdrong tơ'bôh kơ sư.

English: Then King David went in and sat before the LORD; and he said: “Who am I, O Lord GOD? And what is my house, that You have brought me this far?
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Pơtao Đawit năm hloi lăm bơsŭn 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng khan: “Kơkuh kơ ih Kră Yang inh, inh âu bu, hnam dơnŏ inh kiơ mă Ih đei ba inh truh tơ tơdrong jang 'nâu?

English: And yet this was a small thing in Your sight, O Lord GOD; and You have also spoken of Your servant’s house for a great while to come. Is this the manner of man, O Lord GOD?
Bahnar: Kơkuh kơ Ih ơ Kră Yang inh, mă khan tơdrong noh Ih lăng tơdrong iĕ đĕch, păng Ih đei bơtho inh mă đĭch đam Ih kơ dêh char pơtao inh đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp păng ơ Kră Yang inh Ih oei wă ăn kơ inh 'bôh jơhnơr tơ anăp âu kơnh?

English: Now what more can David say to You? For You, Lord GOD, know Your servant.
Bahnar: Đawit wă oei pơma kiơ dơ̆ng hăm Ih? Ơ Kră Yang Kră Yang inh, Ih băt kơ inh đĭch đam Ih.

English: For Your word’s sake, and according to Your own heart, You have done all these great things, to make Your servant know them.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đơ̆ng nơ̆r Ih pơkă, păng kiơ̆ thoi jơhngơ̆m Ih lăp mă Ih đei pơm boih dôm tơdrong tih 'nâu, păng tơbăt ăn kơ đĭch đam Ih.

English: Therefore You are great, O Lord GOD. For there is none like You, nor is there any God besides You, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Kră Yang inh, Ih boih Kră Yang Tih Hloh ưh kơ đei bu hơtŏ kơ Ih, păng ưh kơ đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei nai hloh kơ Ih, thoi kơ đon nhôn đei kơtơ̆ng boih.

English: And who is like Your people, like Israel, the one nation on the earth whom God went to redeem for Himself as a people, to make for Himself a name—and to do for Yourself great and awesome deeds for Your land—before Your people whom You redeemed for Yourself from Egypt, the nations, and their gods?
Bahnar: Tơ jơ̆p lăm teh đak hăm đei adrĕch ayơ nhen thoi adrĕch Isơrael Ih, lăp minh pôm adrĕch đĕch lăm teh âu mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei dŏng pơklaih wă pơm kon pơlei pơla Ih. Anăn Ih đei pơyom tih, iŏk đơ̆ng Ih pơm tơdrong tih-tin trŏ kơ hli krưp tơpă, kơ kon pơlei Ih lăm teh đak Ih. Kră Yang đei puh lê̆ dôm lu adrĕch nai, păng rup yang lu sư đơ̆ng lăm teh đak 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei pơla Ih mă Ih đei dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ.

English: For You have made Your people Israel Your very own people forever; and You, LORD, have become their God.
Bahnar: Ih đei pơjing kơjăp bơngai Isơrael pơm kon pơlei pơla Ih kơdih ling-lang hlŏng hloi. Ơ Kră Yang, Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: “Now, O LORD God, the word which You have spoken concerning Your servant and concerning his house, establish it forever and do as You have said.
Bahnar: Kơkuh kơ Ih ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Inh apinh Ih ling-lang pơm mă kơjăp nơ̆r Ih pơkă gah đĭch đam Ih păng gah hnam sư, apinh Ih pơm thoi Ih đei pơkă boih.

English: So let Your name be magnified forever, saying, ‘The LORD of hosts is the God over Israel.’ And let the house of Your servant David be established before You.
Bahnar: Hơpơi kơ anăn Ih đei ư-ang ling-lang khŏm khŏm, ‘Kră Yang Tih jơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael,’ hơpơi kơ Ih pơjing kơjăp ăn kơ hnam adrĕch đĭch đam Ih Đawit!

English: For You, O LORD of hosts, God of Israel, have revealed this to Your servant, saying, ‘I will build you a house.’ Therefore Your servant has found it in his heart to pray this prayer to You.
Bahnar: Kơkuh kơ Ih, ơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael, kơdih Ih 'mơ̆i đei tơ'bôh tơbăt nơ̆r 'nâu hăm đĭch đam Ih khan, Ih gô pơjing pơdơ̆ng hnam đĭch đam Ih kơjăp, na mă đĭch đam Ih âu jing pơ̆n pơyơ̆r kơ Ih dôm nơ̆r apinh 'nâu.

English: “And now, O Lord GOD, You are God, and Your words are true, and You have promised this goodness to Your servant.
Bahnar: Kơkuh kơ Ih ơ Kră Yang! Ih Kră Yang inh, dôm nơ̆r Ih khan sĭt gô đei pơkă hăm đĭch đam Ih gô ăn kơ sư pŭn hiôk 'nâu.

English: Now therefore, let it please You to bless the house of Your servant, that it may continue before You forever; for You, O Lord GOD, have spoken it, and with Your blessing let the house of Your servant be blessed forever.”
Bahnar: Dang ei inh apinh Kră Yang tuh ăn pŭn hiôk kơ adrĕch hnam bơngai đĭch đam Ih, wă kơ sư oei đei 'bơ̆t anăp Ih ling-lang, yua kơ Ih ơ Kră Yang jơ̆ Kră Yang inh đei pơkă thoi noh. Apinh hơpơi kơ Ih ăn kơ adrĕch hnam đĭch đam Ih đei pŭn hiôk ling-lang.”

English: After this it came to pass that David attacked the Philistines and subdued them. And David took Metheg Ammah from the hand of the Philistines.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Đawit blah bơngai Philistin jei sư, pơjei iŏk pơgơ̆r lu pơlei tih đơ̆ng lu sư păng rôp lu sư pơm bơnă, Đawit blah iŏk pơlei Mathek Ama đơ̆ng bơngai Philistin.

English: Then he defeated Moab. Forcing them down to the ground, he measured them off with a line. With two lines he measured off those to be put to death, and with one full line those to be kept alive. So the Moabites became David’s servants, and brought tribute.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m blah bơngai Môap jei sư, rôp athei lu sư 'bĭch sap tơ teh na iŏk tơlei pơtŏ, mưh 'bar jăl tơlei pơlôch, minh jăl tơlei ăn arih, thoi noh bơngai Môap athei chu jang păng ăn thuê̆ kơ Đawit.

English: David also defeated Hadadezer the son of Rehob, king of Zobah, as he went to recover his territory at the River Euphrates.
Bahnar: Đawit blah Hadadêser kon tơdăm pơtao Rêhôp dêh Sôba; kơplah pơtao 'nâu oei wă năm lăm tơring đak Krong Ơphrat wă pơdơ̆ng ming 'blŏk kơ tơdrong sư pơgơ̆r.

English: David took from him one thousand chariots, seven hundred horsemen, and twenty thousand foot soldiers. Also David hamstrung all the chariot horses, except that he spared enough of them for one hundred chariots.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit rôp linh pơtao Sôba pơm bơnă minh-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng linh hao aseh, păng 'bar-jĭt rơbâu linh năm jơ̆ng, linh pơtao Sôba. Pơtao Đawit kư̆m koh lê̆ huan jon aseh păng aseh dui gre lê̆ kơ lu sư oei pă lăp kơ dui minh-hrĕng tŏ gre đĕch.

English: When the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David killed twenty-two thousand of the Syrians.
Bahnar: Lu linh bơngai Siri đơ̆ng pơlei Đamas wă dŏng pơtao Hadadêser dêh Sôba; Đawit blah pơrăm, păng pơlôch hloi lu sư 'bar-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu 'nu.

English: Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus; and the Syrians became David’s servants, and brought tribute. So the LORD preserved David wherever he went.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit pơm kơđông lăm pơlei Đamas, kon pơlei Siri jing bơngai bơ̆jang ăn kơ Đawit, păng ăn thuê̆ kơ Đawit; Kră Yang ăn kơ Đawit kĕ jei tơ rim anih sư tơblah.

English: And David took the shields of gold that had belonged to the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit blah iŏk dôm lu khêl pơm păng maih đơ̆ng lu yŏng linh wei pơtao Hadadêser păng chĕp ba tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Also from Betah and from Berothai, cities of Hadadezer, King David took a large amount of bronze.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit kư̆m đei thu iŏk lơ mam kong pơtao Hadadêser đơ̆ng pơlei Beta păng pơlei Bêrôthai.

English: When Toi king of Hamath heard that David had defeated all the army of Hadadezer
Bahnar: Tôu pơtao pơlei tih Hamat kơtơ̆ng pơtao Đawit blah pơrăm đĭ lu linh Hadadêser.

English: then Toi sent Joram his son to King David, to greet him and bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer and defeated him (for Hadadezer had been at war with Toi); and Joram brought with him articles of silver, articles of gold, and articles of bronze.
Bahnar: Pơtao Tôu wơh hloi Jôram kon tơdăm sư, năm kơkuh wang chơt hiôk păng pơư kơ pơtao Đawit. Blah pơtao Hadadêser jei sư. Mă tơpă sư pơtao Tôu kư̆m đei tơblah hăm pơtao Hadadêser. Jôram chĕp pơyơ̆r ăn kơ pơtao Đawit lu tơmam pơm hăm kong, maih păng hu.

English: King David also dedicated these to the LORD, along with the silver and gold that he had dedicated from all the nations which he had subdued
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit 'măn lê̆ lu tơmam đe ăn wă pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, kư̆m thoi sư đei 'măn lê̆ lu hu maih đơ̆ng lu bơngai mă sư đei blah pơjei iŏk.

English: from Syria, from Moab, from the people of Ammon, from the Philistines, from Amalek, and from the spoil of Hadadezer the son of Rehob, king of Zobah.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lu bơngai Eđôm, Môap, Ammôn, Philistin, bơngai Amalek păng sư kư̆m pơm thoi tơmam blah iŏk đơ̆ng Hadadêser kon tơdăm Rêhôp, pơtao đe Sôba.

English: And David made himself a name when he returned from killing eighteen thousand Syrians in the Valley of Salt.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ brŏk đơ̆ng tơblah Siri jei sư, Đawit đe pôk pơư anăn sư, yua kơ sư tơblah pơlôch mơjĭt-tơhngam rơbâu linh Eđôm lăm Thŭng 'Boh.

English: He also put garrisons in Edom; throughout all Edom he put garrisons, and all the Edomites became David’s servants. And the LORD preserved David wherever he went.
Bahnar: Sư pơm kơđông pơgơ̆r jơ̆p kơ dêh Eđôm, păng đĭ kon pơlei Eđôm bơ̆jang kơ Đawit. Kră Yang ăn kơ Đawit kĕ jei tơ rim anih mă sư tơblah.

English: So David reigned over all Israel; and David administered judgment and justice to all his people.
Bahnar: Đawit pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r kơ đĭ-đăng dêh char Isơrael, pơgơ̆r kon pơlei sư hăm tơdrong juăt trŏ tơpăt.

English: Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder
Bahnar: Jôap kon tơdăm yă Sêruia pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r linh; Jêhôsaphat kon tơdăm Ahilut pơm yŏng chih răk dôm tơdrong truh.

English: Zadok the son of Ahitub and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar were the priests; Seraiah was the scribe
Bahnar: Sadok kon tơdăm, Ahitup păng Ahimelek kon tơdăm Abiathar pơm 'bok soi; păng Sêraia pơm 'bok yŏng chih hla bơar.

English: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over both the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David’s sons were chief ministers.
Bahnar: Bênaia kon tơdăm Jêhôiada pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r linh wei pơtao, lu kon pơlei Kêrêthit păng kon pơlei Pêlithit; gah lu kon drŏ-nglo Đawit tơgŭm sư chă đon.

English: Now David said, “Is there still anyone who is left of the house of Saul, that I may show him kindness for Jonathan’s sake?”
Bahnar: Đawit jet lăm hnam Sôl hăm oei đei bu oei arih ưh? Inh wă tơ'bôh jơhngơ̆m pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ sư yua kơ đơ̆ng Jônathan.

English: And there was a servant of the house of Saul whose name was Ziba. So when they had called him to David, the king said to him, “Are you Ziba?” He said, “At your service!”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu đĭch đam đơ̆ng lăm hnam Sôl, anăn sư Siba; đe krao sư năm tơ Đawit, pơtao Đawit jet: Ih hăm trŏ kơ Siba ưh? Sư tơl: Trŏ inh âu boih, đĭch đam ih

English: Then the king said, “Is there not still someone of the house of Saul, to whom I may show the kindness of God?” And Ziba said to the king, “There is still a son of Jonathan who is lame in his feet.”
Bahnar: Pơtao jet dơ̆ng: Lăm hnam Sôl ưh pă đei bu dơ̆ng ah? Inh wă iŏk tơdrong 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, na sơng iŏk sư. Siba tơl pơtao: Oei pă minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Jônathan sư hơwen 'bar pah jơ̆ng.

English: So the king said to him, “Where is he?” And Ziba said to the king, “Indeed he is in the house of Machir the son of Ammiel, in Lo Debar.”
Bahnar: Pơtao jet: “Sư tơ yơ?” Siba tơl: “Sư oei lăm hnam Makir, kon drŏ-nglo Ammiel, tơ pơlei Lôdêbar.”

English: Then King David sent and brought him out of the house of Machir the son of Ammiel, from Lo Debar.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit wơh hloi sư năm tơ hnam Makir, kon drŏ-nglo Ammiel, tơ pơlei Lôdêbar, wă kơ sư năm iŏk bơngai noh.

English: Now when Mephibosheth the son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, had come to David, he fell on his face and prostrated himself. Then David said, “Mephibosheth?” And he answered, “Here is your servant!”
Bahnar: Lăp Mêphibôset, kon drŏ-nglo Jônathan, sâu tơm 'bok Sôl, truh tơ Đawit boih, na sư pơtăm kŭl-tăng kŭp drap tơ teh păng kơkuh. Đawit krao: Ơ Mêphibôset! Sư tơl: Kiơ đĭch đam ih âu.

English: So David said to him, “Do not fear, for I will surely show you kindness for Jonathan your father’s sake, and will restore to you all the land of Saul your grandfather; and you shall eat bread at my table continually.”
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ sư: Mon 'nĕ kơ hli, inh wă tơgŭm ih yua kơ đơ̆ng Jônathan 'bă ih, inh gô pơdrâu kơ ih dôm mă bri seh teh choh đơ̆ng 'bok Sôl ih, păng ih gô oei sŏng sa hơdai inh minh pôm gơ'bang ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: Then he bowed himself, and said, “What is your servant, that you should look upon such a dead dog as I?”
Bahnar: Mêphibôset drap tơ teh kơkuh, na sư pơma khan: “Bơngai đĭch đam ih 'nâu kiơ, mă ih oei tơchĕng 'blŏk 'blăi inh âu thoi minh pôm kŏ lôch?”

English: And the king called to Ziba, Saul’s servant, and said to him, “I have given to your master’s son all that belonged to Saul and to all his house.
Bahnar: Pơtao krao hloi Siba, đĭch đam Sôl, sư khan: Đĭ-đăng mŭk tơmam gah Sôl păng hnam dơnŏ sư. Inh ăn boih kơ sâu tơnơm yŏng tơ'ngla ih.

English: You therefore, and your sons and your servants, shall work the land for him, and you shall bring in the harvest, that your master’s son may have food to eat. But Mephibosheth your master’s son shall eat bread at my table always.” Now Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo păng đĭch đam ih athei choh pơtăm teh mir noh ăn kơ sư, đei plei phe 'ba na yua iŏk 'me hnam dơnŏ yŏng tơ'ngla ih, mă-lei gah Mêphibôset sư gô oei sŏng sa hơdai inh pôm gơ'bang hlŏng hloi boih. Siba đei mơjĭt-pơđăm 'nu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'bar-jĭt 'nu đĭch đam.

English: Then Ziba said to the king, “According to all that my lord the king has commanded his servant, so will your servant do.” “As for Mephibosheth,” said the king, “he shall eat at my table like one of the king’s sons.”
Bahnar: Siba drơ̆ng khan: Đĭch đam ih gô pơm kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong đơ̆ng yŏng pơtao inh pơkă khan. Thoi noh Mêphibôset sŏng sa hơdai minh pôm gơ'bang hăm pơtao Đawit thoi minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo pơtao.

English: Mephibosheth had a young son whose name was Micha. And all who dwelt in the house of Ziba were servants of Mephibosheth.
Bahnar: Mêphibôset đei minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo 'lơ̆p, anăn sư Mika; păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai oei lăm hnam Siba jing đĭch đam Mephibôset ngăl.

English: So Mephibosheth dwelt in Jerusalem, for he ate continually at the king’s table. And he was lame in both his feet.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Mêphibôset oei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, yua kơ sư sŏng sa hơdai pơtao minh gơ'bang ling-lang, mă sư hơwen hơwo 'bar pah jơ̆ng ră.

English: It happened after this that the king of the people of Ammon died, and Hanun his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ pơtao bơngai Ammôn lôch, na Hanun kon drŏ-nglo sư pơgơ̆r, pơtrơp sư.

English: Then David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, as his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent by the hand of his servants to comfort him concerning his father. And David’s servants came into the land of the people of Ammon.
Bahnar: Đawit khan: “Inh 'maih pơm hiôk hăm Hanun, kon drŏ-nglo Nabas, kư̆m thoi 'bă sư hlôi pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ inh boih” Đawit wơh đĭch đam sư năm ngôi pơlung pơtao Hanun gah tơdrong 'bă sư lôch. Lu đĭch đam Đawit năm truh tơ lăm dêh char kon pơlei Ammôn.

English: And the princes of the people of Ammon said to Hanun their lord, “Do you think that David really honors your father because he has sent comforters to you? Has David not rather sent his servants to you to search the city, to spy it out, and to overthrow it?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu yŏng wei-lăng kon pơlei Ammôn roi kơ yŏng tơ'ngla sư pơtao Hanun: “Ih tơchĕng khan Đawit wơh lu bơngai năm ngôi pơlung ih yua kơ lu sư pơyom kơ 'bă ih hă? Ưh ôh! Đawit wơh lu bơngai đĭch đam sư năm truh tơ ih lu sư 'maih wă chop lăng lu pơlei tih đĕch păng wă blah iŏk dơning kơnh;”

English: Therefore Hanun took David’s servants, shaved off half of their beards, cut off their garments in the middle, at their buttocks, and sent them away.
Bahnar: Pơtao Hanun athei đe rôp lu đĭch đam Đawit, na hơkôih lê̆ sŏk kang lu sư minh pah tơ'bŏk, kăt lê̆ minh pah hơbĕn ao lu sư gah pơtâu, na ăn kơ lu sư brŏk.

English: When they told David, he sent to meet them, because the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, “Wait at Jericho until your beards have grown, and then return.”
Bahnar: Đawit kơtơ̆ng tơdrong ei, na sư wơh lu bơngai năm sơng lu đe ei, yua kơ lu sư mơn mơlâu dêh, pơtao pơkă kơ lu sư: “Lu iĕm oei tơ pơlei Jêrikô dĭng truh tơ sŏk kang lu iĕm chăt 'mơ̆i; na lu iĕm wih brŏk.”

English: When the people of Ammon saw that they had made themselves repulsive to David, the people of Ammon sent and hired the Syrians of Beth Rehob and the Syrians of Zoba, twenty thousand foot soldiers; and from the king of Maacah one thousand men, and from Ish-Tob twelve thousand men.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Ammôn băt kơ lu sư pơm wă kơ Đawit blĕk, na wơh bơngai năm mưng iŏk kon pơlei Siri oei tơ pơlei Bêtrêhot păng tơ Sôba dang 'bar-jĭt rơbâu 'nu linh, na mưng iŏk đơ̆ng pơtao Maaka minh-rơbâu 'nu linh, păng mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng pơlei Top.

English: Now when David heard of it, he sent Joab and all the army of the mighty men.
Bahnar: Đawit kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, na wơh hloi Jôap yŏng linh hăm lu bơngai linh nuih kơtang sư năm tơblah.

English: Then the people of Ammon came out and put themselves in battle array at the entrance of the gate. And the Syrians of Zoba, Beth Rehob, Ish-Tob, and Maacah were by themselves in the field.
Bahnar: Khŭl linh Ammôn lĕch dă 'bơ̆t trong wă mơ̆t tơ pơlei tih, gah lu linh Siri dă 'bơ̆t Sôba păng oei tơ Rêhôp, lu linh oei tơ pơlei Top păng oei tơ Maaka lu sư dă kơdih pha tơ bri tơ tơmăn glă.

English: When Joab saw that the battle line was against him before and behind, he chose some of Israel’s best and put them in battle array against the Syrians.
Bahnar: Wă Jôap yŏng linh 'bôh lu linh ayăt wă blah 'bar pah gah anăp gah rŏng kơ lu sư, na sư rơih lu linh nuih kơtang lăm lu bơngai Isơrael săp dă năm tơblah lu linh bơngai Siri.

English: And the rest of the people he put under the command of Abishai his brother, that he might set them in battle array against the people of Ammon.
Bahnar: Gah lu linh mă oei oei, sư pơjao ăn kơ Abisai oh sư, săp dă năm tơblah hăm lu linh Ammôn.

English: Then he said, “If the Syrians are too strong for me, then you shall help me; but if the people of Ammon are too strong for you, then I will come and help you.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ Abisai: “Tơdah lu linh Siri pran hloh kơ inh, ih gô năm tơgŭm inh, mă-lei tơdah lu linh Ammôn pran hloh kơ ih, inh gô năm tơgŭm ih.”

English: Be of good courage, and let us be strong for our people and for the cities of our God. And may the LORD do what is good in His sight.”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hli athei tơblah mă nuih đĭ jơhngơ̆m wă wei kon pơlei pơla bơ̆n, păng lu pơlei tih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n; hơpơi kơ Kră Yang pơm kiơ̆ thoi Sư tơchĕng 'lơ̆ng!

English: So Joab and the people who were with him drew near for the battle against the Syrians, and they fled before him.
Bahnar: Jôap hăm lu linh kiơ̆ sư năm tơblah hăm lu linh Siri, lu linh Siri thuơ chă kơdâu ôn.

English: When the people of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fleeing, they also fled before Abishai, and entered the city. So Joab returned from the people of Ammon and went to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Wă lu linh Ammôn 'bôh lu linh Siri kơdâu, na lu sư kư̆m kơdâu weh 'bơ̆t anăp Abisai, păng mơ̆t ôn lăm pơlei. Jôap weh ưh pă blah lu linh Ammôn na hơlơ̆k brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: When the Syrians saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they gathered together.
Bahnar: Lu linh Siri 'bôh sư blah jei lu linh bơngai Isơrael, na pơtơm akŭm pơpôi băl dơ̆ng.

English: Then Hadadezer sent and brought out the Syrians who were beyond the River, and they came to Helam. And Shobach the commander of Hadadezer’s army went before them.
Bahnar: Pơtao Hadadêser wơh bơngai năm akŭm linh Siri mă oei tơ pah to Krong Ơphrat; lu sư năm truh tơ pơlei Hêlam, đei Sobak pơm yŏng linh pơgơ̆r linh Hadadêser.

English: When it was told David, he gathered all Israel, crossed over the Jordan, and came to Helam. And the Syrians set themselves in battle array against David and fought with him.
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'nâu, Đawit akŭm pơpôi dơ̆ng đĭ-đăng lu linh bơngai Isơrael năm tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, năm truh tơ Hêlam, tơ noh lu linh Siri săp dă wă tơblah hăm pơtao Đawit păng lu linh Siri tơblah hloi.

English: Then the Syrians fled before Israel; and David killed seven hundred charioteers and forty thousand horsemen of the Syrians, and struck Shobach the commander of their army, who died there.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu linh Siri thuơ kơdâu đơ̆ng anăp lu linh Isơrael, Đawit pơlôch lu linh Siri pơrăm tơpơh-hrĕng tŏ gre aseh, păng puăn-jĭt rơbâu 'nu lu linh bơngai Siri. Sobak yŏng pơgơ̆r linh Siri rơka hngăm dêh păng lôch hloi tơ noh.

English: And when all the kings who were servants to Hadadezer saw that they were defeated by Israel, they made peace with Israel and served them. So the Syrians were afraid to help the people of Ammon anymore.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng lu pơtao kiơ̆ pơtao Hadadêser 'bôh khŭl linh Siri thuơ kơ lu linh bơngai Isơrael, na lu sư apinh lung pơm hiôk hăm lu bơngai Isơrael păng mơ̆t khŭl lu bơngai Isơrael. Lu linh Siri pă pơ̆n dŏng lu kon pơlei Ammôn dơ̆ng.

English: It happened in the spring of the year, at the time when kings go out to battle, that David sent Joab and his servants with him, and all Israel; and they destroyed the people of Ammon and besieged Rabbah. But David remained at Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lăm bơyan puih lu pơtao juăt kơ năm tơblah, Đawit wơh Jôap hăm lu đĭch đam sư păng đĭ-đăng lu linh bơngai Isơrael năm tơblah; lu sư tơgar iŏk dêh kon pơlei Ammôn păng wang tăp kơ pơlei Rapba. Gah pơtao Đawit oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Then it happened one evening that David arose from his bed and walked on the roof of the king’s house. And from the roof he saw a woman bathing, and the woman was very beautiful to behold.
Bahnar: Lăm minh kơsơ̆ ei Đawit iung đơ̆ng tep pơdơh 'năr dơ̆ng sư chă ngôi dăr tơ kơpal bơbŭng hnam pơtao na 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn oei hum, bơngai drŏ-kăn ei 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ dêh.

English: So David sent and inquired about the woman. And someone said, “Is this not Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam, the wife of Uriah the Hittite?”
Bahnar: Đawit wơh bơngai năm jet bơngai drŏ-kăn ei, na đe khan: “Noh Batsêba, kon drŏ-kăn Êliam, akăn Uri, bơngai Hêtit.”

English: Then David sent messengers, and took her; and she came to him, and he lay with her, for she was cleansed from her impurity; and she returned to her house.
Bahnar: Đawit wơh bơngai năm krao iŏk sư; sư 'nao 'nhao ôp rơgoh tơdrong sư 'bôh jơ̆ng; sư năm truh tơ hnam pơtao, na pơtao tep hơdai hăm sư, đơ̆ng noh sư wih tơ hnam.

English: And the woman conceived; so she sent and told David, and said, “I am with child.”
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn 'nâu sư anăp, sư wơh bơngai năm roi kơ Đawit khan: “Inh anăp boih.”

English: Then David sent to Joab, saying, “Send me Uriah the Hittite.” And Joab sent Uriah to David.
Bahnar: Đawit wơh năm khan kơ Jôap: “Athei Uri, bơngai Hêtit năm tơ'bơ̆p inh.” Na, Jôap athei Uri năm tơ'bơ̆p Đawit.

English: When Uriah had come to him, David asked how Joab was doing, and how the people were doing, and how the war prospered.
Bahnar: Uri năm truh tơ Đawit, Đawit jet gia gah Jôap yŏng linh hăm oei liĕm akâu, bĕ lu linh hăm oei hiôk hơđơ̆ng păng tơdrong tơblah thoi yơ.

English: And David said to Uriah, “Go down to your house and wash your feet.” So Uriah departed from the king’s house, and a gift of food from the king followed him.
Bahnar: Na Đawit pơma dơnuh hăm Uri: “Năm wih brŏk bĕ tơ hnam ih, păng ôp hơrao jơ̆ng ih.” Na, Uri lĕch đơ̆ng hnam pơtao, pơtao wơh minh 'nu bơngai chĕp ba kơ sư tơmam đơ̆ng hnam pơtao ăn.

English: But Uriah slept at the door of the king’s house with all the servants of his lord, and did not go down to his house.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, Uri ưh kơ brŏk tơ hnam, sư tep 'bơ̆t 'măng jang hnam pơtao hơdai hăm lu đĭch đam gak pơtao.

English: So when they told David, saying, “Uriah did not go down to his house,” David said to Uriah, “Did you not come from a journey? Why did you not go down to your house?”
Bahnar: Đe roi ăn kơ Đawit băt: “Uri ưh kơ brŏk tơ hnam sư.” Đawit jet Uri: “Liơ ih ưh kơ brŏk tơ hnam, yua kơ ih 'nao brŏk đơ̆ng trong ataih.”

English: And Uriah said to David, “The ark and Israel and Judah are dwelling in tents, and my lord Joab and the servants of my lord are encamped in the open fields. Shall I then go to my house to eat and drink, and to lie with my wife? As you live, and as your soul lives, I will not do this thing.”
Bahnar: Uri tơl Đawit: “Hom pơgơ̆p lu linh Isơrael păng Juđa oei tơ lăm bơsŭn, Jôap yŏng tơ'ngla inh, hăm lu đĭch đam oei tơ bri, na inh wă brŏk tơ hnam sŏng sa păng tep hơdai păng akăn inh hă? Inh pơkă hăm ih, inh ưh kơ gơh pơm minh tơdrong thoi noh”

English: Then David said to Uriah, “Wait here today also, and tomorrow I will let you depart.” So Uriah remained in Jerusalem that day and the next.
Bahnar: Đawit khan: “Ih oei tơ âu năr 'nâu dơ̆ng, dơning ih brŏk.” Na Uri oei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem lăm năr ei păng năr đơ̆ng rŏng.

English: Now when David called him, he ate and drank before him; and he made him drunk. And at evening he went out to lie on his bed with the servants of his lord, but he did not go down to his house.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Đawit wơ̆n sư sŏng sa, ăn kơ sư huch tơdrô mă suai; mă-lei truh kơmăng noh Uri năm tep tơ hơkok sư hăm lu đĭch đam gak pơtao, kư̆m ưh kơ brŏk tơ hnam sư.

English: In the morning it happened that David wrote a letter to Joab and sent it by the hand of Uriah.
Bahnar: Pơgê đơ̆ng rŏng, Đawit chih minh hlak hla bơar kơthơ ăn kơ Uri chĕp ba kơ Jôap.

English: And he wrote in the letter, saying, “Set Uriah in the forefront of the hottest battle, and retreat from him, that he may be struck down and die.”
Bahnar: Lăm kơthơ sư chih thoi âu: “Dan bĕ Uri yak adrol lăm năr tơblah tih, na lu iĕm kơdŭn ataih đơ̆ng sư, wă kơ sư rơka na lôch.”

English: So it was, while Joab besieged the city, that he assigned Uriah to a place where he knew there were valiant men.
Bahnar: Kơplah wang tăp pơlei na Jôap dan Uri 'bơ̆t tơklă anih lu linh ayăt pran kơtang.

English: Then the men of the city came out and fought with Joab. And some of the people of the servants of David fell; and Uriah the Hittite died also.
Bahnar: Lu linh đơ̆ng lăm pơlei lĕch blah linh Jôap, đei lu mơ'nah bơngai lăm khŭl đĭch đam Đawit lôch, Uri bơngai Hêtit kư̆m dai lôch.

English: Then Joab sent and told David all the things concerning the war
Bahnar: Jôap wơh bơngai năm roi kơ Đawit băt dôm tơdrong tơblah.
