Bahnar: Đe năm roi ăn kơ Jôap: “Pơtao nhơ̆m hmoi dêh ơh 'mêm kơ Apsalôm”

English: So the victory that day was turned into mourning for all the people. For the people heard it said that day, “The king is grieved for his son.”
Bahnar: Lăm năr tơdrong sư tơblah jei, tơplih jing tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla, yua kơ kon pơlei pơla kơtơ̆ng ang khan pơtao nhơ̆m hmoi ơh sơ'ngon 'mêm kơ kon sư.

English: And the people stole back into the city that day, as people who are ashamed steal away when they flee in battle.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh khŭl linh klen klon mơ̆t lăm pơlei nhen thoi lu khŭl linh mơlâu klen klon kơdâu ôn đơ̆ng tơblah.

English: But the king covered his face, and the king cried out with a loud voice, “O my son Absalom! O Absalom, my son, my son!”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh pơtao gom muh măt hmoi ôr re khan: “Ơ Apsalôm kon dăm inh! Ơ Apsalôm kon dăm inh! Kon dăm inh!”

English: Then Joab came into the house to the king, and said, “Today you have disgraced all your servants who today have saved your life, the lives of your sons and daughters, the lives of your wives and the lives of your concubines
Bahnar: Jôap mơ̆t lăm hnam pơtao păng khan: “Năr 'nâu pơtao pơm ăn kơ đĭ-đăng lu đĭch đam ih mơlâu, jơ̆ lu bơngai noh boih mă dŏng pơklaih tơdrong arih pơtao, lu kon drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn pơtao, hăm dŏng pơklaih đĭ-đăng tơdrong arih lu akăn tơm păng lu akăn kơnhŏng ih hai mơ̆n.

English: in that you love your enemies and hate your friends. For you have declared today that you regard neither princes nor servants; for today I perceive that if Absalom had lived and all of us had died today, then it would have pleased you well.
Bahnar: Na, ih 'mêm kơ lu bơngai areh kơ ih na areh kơ lu bơngai mă 'mêm kơ ih! Tơdrong mă pơtao pơm năr 'nâu wă kơ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r linh păng lu linh pơtao 'bôh hơđăl, ih lăng lu sư ưh kơ đei lĕch kiơ. Inh 'bôh hơđăl pơtao gô lăp đon ngei tơdah Apsalôm oei arih năr 'nâu, mă khan đĭ-đăng kơ lu nhôn lôch.

English: Now therefore, arise, go out and speak comfort to your servants. For I swear by the LORD, if you do not go out, not one will stay with you this night. And that will be worse for you than all the evil that has befallen you from your youth until now.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei pơtao jah iung bĕ, năm pơma pơlung jơhngơ̆m lu đĭch đam ih hloi; inh pao anăn Kră Yang na pơkă, tơdah pơtao ưh kơ năm pơlung, lei lăm măng 'nâu ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bơngai bu oei hơdai hăm ih; păng noh boih tơdrong gô truh pơmat trăp hloh kơ lu tơdrong đei truh kơ pơtao mă đơ̆ng kơplah oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆ truh kơ dang ei.”

English: Then the king arose and sat in the gate. And they told all the people, saying, “There is the king, sitting in the gate.” So all the people came before the king. For everyone of Israel had fled to his tent.
Bahnar: Pơtao iung lĕch ngôi 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei. Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla băt khan pơtao ngôi 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei, na pơma dơnuh hăm pơtao. Kơplah noh lu linh Isơrael kơdâu brŏk tơ hnam lu sư kơdih.

English: Now all the people were in a dispute throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, “The king saved us from the hand of our enemies, he delivered us from the hand of the Philistines, and now he has fled from the land because of Absalom.
Bahnar: Lăm lu adrĕch adrung Isơrael lu sư pơđâu băl khan: “Pơtao dŏng pơklaih boih lu bơ̆n đơ̆ng ti bơngai ayăt kơ lu bơ̆n, păng sư đei pơklaih lu bơ̆n đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai Philistin. Na dang ei, sư mah kơdâu ôn đơ̆ng dêh char yua kơ Apsalôm.

English: But Absalom, whom we anointed over us, has died in battle. Now therefore, why do you say nothing about bringing back the king?”
Bahnar: Na Apsalôm mă lu bơ̆n tuh boih đak pơgang 'bâu phu pôk pơm pơtao lu bơ̆n, dang ei lôch boih. Lei na, dang ei liơ lu bơ̆n ưh kơ pơma pơđâu pơtơm pơtao brŏk?”

English: So King David sent to Zadok and Abiathar the priests, saying, “Speak to the elders of Judah, saying, ‘Why are you the last to bring the king back to his house, since the words of all Israel have come to the king, to his very house?
Bahnar: Nơ̆r đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael pơma băl gah tơdrong sơng iŏk pơtao brŏk kơtơ̆ng truh tơ pơtao boih; pơtao Đawit wơh bơngai năm tơ bre 'bok soi, Sađŏk, păng Abiathar: “Măr iĕm khan bĕ kơ lu bơngai kră Juđa: ‘Liơ mă tă tơ lu iĕm jing bơngai tuch-luch năm krao pơtơm pơtao brŏk tơ hnam sư?’

English: You are my brethren, you are my bone and my flesh. Why then are you the last to bring back the king?’
Bahnar: Lu iĕm jơ̆ 'nhŏng oh inh, jơ̆ sĕch akar inh! Liơ mă lu iĕm jing tă tơ bơngai tuch-luch krao pơtơm pơtao brŏk?

English: And say to Amasa, ‘Are you not my bone and my flesh? God do so to me, and more also, if you are not commander of the army before me continually in place of Joab.’ ”
Bahnar: Apinh măr iĕm kư̆m athei khan kơ Amasa: ‘Ih jơ̆ sĕch akar inh. Tơdah đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp ih ưh kơ pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r linh tơplih Jôap lei apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei phak inh trăp hloh!’ ”

English: So he swayed the hearts of all the men of Judah, just as the heart of one man, so that they sent this word to the king: “Return, you and all your servants!”
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit pơm lăp đon kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđa, lu sư minh jơhngơ̆m đon wơh bơngai năm wơ̆n pơtao: “Apinh pơtao hăm đĭ-đăng đĭch đam pơtao wih brŏk bĕ.”

English: Then the king returned and came to the Jordan. And Judah came to Gilgal, to go to meet the king, to escort the king across the Jordan.
Bahnar: Na pơtao iung brŏk truh 'bơ̆t đak Krong Jôrđăn. Lu bơngai Juđa kư̆m năm truh sơng iŏk pơtao 'bơ̆t Gilgal wă ba pơtao năm tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn.

English: And Shimei the son of Gera, a Benjamite, who was from Bahurim, hurried and came down with the men of Judah to meet King David.
Bahnar: Simêi, kon drŏ-nglo Gêra, bơngai Bênjamin oei tơ Bahurim, hăt hot năm jur hăm lu bơngai Juđa wă sơng pơtao Đawit.

English: There were a thousand men of Benjamin with him, and Ziba the servant of the house of Saul, and his fifteen sons and his twenty servants with him; and they went over the Jordan before the king.
Bahnar: Simêi chông ba minh-rơbâu 'nu bơngai Bênjamin kiơ̆ sư. Siba, đĭch đam wei-lăng hnam Sôl, hăm mơjĭt-pơđăm 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, păng 'bar-jĭt 'nu đĭch đam sư, lu sư năm hăt hot truh tơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, adrol kơ pơtao.

English: Then a ferryboat went across to carry over the king’s household, and to do what he thought good. Now Shimei the son of Gera fell down before the king when he had crossed the Jordan.
Bahnar: Lu sư glơi wih wơ̆t to âu wă hơtŏk hnam dơnŏ pơtao tŏk kơ krong, păng pơm dôm tơdrong kiơ pơtao wă. Simêi, kon drŏ-nglo Gêra, kơkuh drap ala jơ̆ng pơtao Đawit kơplah pơtao wă tŏk kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn.

English: Then he said to the king, “Do not let my lord impute iniquity to me, or remember what wrong your servant did on the day that my lord the king left Jerusalem, that the king should take it to heart.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ pơtao: “Apinh yŏng tơ'ngla inh, 'nĕ kơ jô̆ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ inh, păng 'nĕ kơ 'blŏk tơdrong đĭch đam ih mă đei pơm yoch boih lăm năr ih yŏng tơ'ngla inh lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem. Apinh ih 'nĕ pă 'blŏk răk tơdrong noh.

English: For I, your servant, know that I have sinned. Therefore here I am, the first to come today of all the house of Joseph to go down to meet my lord the king.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh đĭch đam ih băt kơdih yoch boih. Na dang ei lăm đĭ-đăng adrĕch hnam Jôsep, inh boih truh adrol wă jur sơng ih yŏng tơ'ngla inh.”

English: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah answered and said, “Shall not Shimei be put to death for this, because he cursed the LORD’s anointed?”
Bahnar: Abisai, kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia, tơl khan: “Simêi ưh kơ trŏ pơlôch sư yua kơ tơdrong noh hă? Sư bơngai hiap pơtê̆ tơ'ngla mă Kră Yang rơih iŏk!”

English: And David said, “What have I to do with you, you sons of Zeruiah, that you should be adversaries to me today? Shall any man be put to death today in Israel? For do I not know that today I am king over Israel?”
Bahnar: Đawit khan: “Ơ lu kon drŏ-nglo yă Sêruia, tơdrong inh 'bơm kiơ kơ lu iĕm, na lu iĕm mă oei wă ayăt kơ inh năr 'nâu? Hăm gơh pơlôch minh 'nu bơngai ayơ lăm teh đak Isơrael năr âu ưh? Inh ưh kơ băt năr 'nâu inh pơm pơtao Isơrael hă?”

English: Therefore the king said to Shimei, “You shall not die.” And the king swore to him.
Bahnar: Pơtao pơkă hăm Simêi: “Ih ưh kơ đei lôch ôh.”

English: Now Mephibosheth the son of Saul came down to meet the king. And he had not cared for his feet, nor trimmed his mustache, nor washed his clothes, from the day the king departed until the day he returned in peace.
Bahnar: Mephibôset sâu drŏ-nglo Sôl, kư̆m năm jur sơng pơtao, sư ưh kơ đei ôp jơ̆ng, yuă sŏk kang dah pih hơbĕn ao sư iŏk đơ̆ng năr pơtao yak năm truh tơ năr pơtao wih brŏk hiôk-hian.

English: So it was, when he had come to Jerusalem to meet the king, that the king said to him, “Why did you not go with me, Mephibosheth?”
Bahnar: Kơplah sư đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem năm sơng pơtao, Đawit jet sư: “Ơ, Mephibôset, liơ ih ưh kơ năm hăm inh?”

English: And he answered, “My lord, O king, my servant deceived me. For your servant said, ‘I will saddle a donkey for myself, that I may ride on it and go to the king,’ because your servant is lame.
Bahnar: Sư tơl: “Ơ pơtao yŏng tơ'ngla inh! Đĭch đam inh hơlĕnh kơ inh,” inh athei sư: “Năm chă ăn kơ inh aseh iĕ, inh wă hao năm kiơ̆ pơtao, yua kơ inh đĭch đam ih âu jopo

English: And he has slandered your servant to my lord the king, but my lord the king is like the angel of God. Therefore do what is good in your eyes.
Bahnar: Sư roi hơlĕnh kơ inh hăm ih yŏng tơ'ngla inh; mă-lei pơtao yŏng tơ'ngla inh thoi lĕ minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Apinh ih pơm kơ inh kiơ̆ kơ ih tơchĕng trŏ.

English: For all my father’s house were but dead men before my lord the king. Yet you set your servant among those who eat at your own table. Therefore what right have I still to cry out anymore to the king?”
Bahnar: Tơpă, lu bơngai lăm adrĕch hnam 'bă inh trŏ kơ pơlôch. Mă-lei pơtao ăn kơ inh gơh song sa hơdai hăm pơtao tơ gơ'bang. Lei na, inh wă đei tơdrong kiơ dơ̆ng gơh pơma hăm pơtao?”

English: So the king said to him, “Why do you speak anymore of your matters? I have said, ‘You and Ziba divide the land.’ ”
Bahnar: Pơtao khan: “Ih huay pă pơma dơ̆ng. Inh athei boih ih păng Siba asong băl teh.”

English: Then Mephibosheth said to the king, “Rather, let him take it all, inasmuch as my lord the king has come back in peace to his own house.”
Bahnar: Mephibôset khan: “Lê̆ Siba iŏk đĭ kư̆m bưh mơ̆n, đei pơtao yŏng tơ'ngla inh wih brŏk hiôk-hian tơ hnam noh inh hiôk boih.”

English: And Barzillai the Gileadite came down from Rogelim and went across the Jordan with the king, to escort him across the Jordan.
Bahnar: Barsilai bơngai Gileat kư̆m jur năm đơ̆ng pơlei Rogelim, năm kiơ̆ ba pơtao tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn.

English: Now Barzillai was a very aged man, eighty years old. And he had provided the king with supplies while he stayed at Mahanaim, for he was a very rich man.
Bahnar: Barsilai kră dêh boih, sư đei tơhngam-jĭt sơnăm. Sư boih bơngai ăn kơ pơtao tơmam sa kơplah pơtao oei lăm pơlei Mahanaim, yua kơ sư mơdrŏng dêh.

English: And the king said to Barzillai, “Come across with me, and I will provide for you while you are with me in Jerusalem.”
Bahnar: Pơtao khan kơ Barsilai: “Năm tŏk kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn hơdai inh, păng oei hăm inh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem inh gô wei rong ih.”

English: But Barzillai said to the king, “How long have I to live, that I should go up with the king to Jerusalem?
Bahnar: Mă-lei Barsilai tơl pơtao: “Inh oei arih dôm yơ sơnăm dơ̆ng na mah năm oei hăm ih tơ pơlei Jêrusalem?

English: I am today eighty years old. Can I discern between the good and bad? Can your servant taste what I eat or what I drink? Can I hear any longer the voice of singing men and singing women? Why then should your servant be a further burden to my lord the king?
Bahnar: Dang ei inh đei tơhngam-jĭt sơnăm boih, inh ưh pă băt kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng păng tơdrong kơnê̆ dơ̆ng boih Đĭch đam ih kư̆m ưh pă băt kơ tơmam sa, đak nhă nham dah ưh. Kŭm ưh pă gơh mơ̆ng nơ̆r hơri lu khŭl drŏ-nglo, drŏ-kăn hiôk dah ưh Đĭch đam ih pơnĕ pơm pơmat kơ pơtao yŏng tơ'ngla inh đĕch

English: Your servant will go a little way across the Jordan with the king. And why should the king repay me with such a reward?
Bahnar: Đĭch đam pơtao adrin tŏk hlôi kơ Krong Jôrđăn hăm pơtao đĕch, ưh kơ trŏ kơ pơtao mah wă apah inh thoi noh

English: Please let your servant turn back again, that I may die in my own city, near the grave of my father and mother. But here is your servant Chimham; let him cross over with my lord the king, and do for him what seems good to you.”
Bahnar: Apinh ăn kơ inh brŏk, wă kơ inh lôch lăm pơlei inh, jê̆ bơsat mĕ 'bă inh, mă-lei đei Kimham âu, đĭch đam ih; ăn kơ sư kiơ̆ ih yŏng tơ'ngla inh, păng apinh ih wei rong sư kiơ̆ kơ ih tơchĕng.”

English: And the king answered, “Chimham shall cross over with me, and I will do for him what seems good to you. Now whatever you request of me, I will do for you.”
Bahnar: Pơtao tơl: “Kimham gô năm kiơ̆, păng inh gô rong ba sư kiơ̆ kơ ih wă. Ih apinh inh tơdrong kiơ, inh gô ăn kơ ih.”

English: Then all the people went over the Jordan. And when the king had crossed over, the king kissed Barzillai and blessed him, and he returned to his own place.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng linh păng kon pơlei tŏk găn kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, pơtao kư̆m tŏk, pơtao chŭm Barsilai păng tơklah băl. Barsilai wih tơ pơlei sư kơdih.

English: Now the king went on to Gilgal, and Chimham went on with him. And all the people of Judah escorted the king, and also half the people of Israel.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh pơtao năm truh tơ pơlei Gilgal. Kimham kư̆m năm, đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Juđa, păng hloh kơ minh puăt kon pơlei Isơrael kư̆m năm kiơ̆ ba pơtao.

English: Just then all the men of Israel came to the king, and said to the king, “Why have our brethren, the men of Judah, stolen you away and brought the king, his household, and all David’s men with him across the Jordan?”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael năm jet pơtao: “Liơ 'nhŏng oh lu nhôn bơngai Juđa klĕnh chông ba ih, hnam dơnŏ ih păng đĭ-đăng bơngai kiơ̆ ih tŏk kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn?”

English: So all the men of Judah answered the men of Israel, “Because the king is a close relative of ours. Why then are you angry over this matter? Have we ever eaten at the king’s expense? Or has he given us any gift?”
Bahnar: Bơngai Juđa tơl: “Yua kơ lu nhôn 'nhŏng oh hăm pơtao. Na liơ mă lu iĕm blĕk? Lu nhôn đei sa yua tơmam kiơ đơ̆ng pơtao ưh? Pơtao hăm đei ăn đĕch kơ lu nhôn tơmam kiơ?”

English: And the men of Israel answered the men of Judah, and said, “We have ten shares in the king; therefore we also have more right to David than you. Why then do you despise us—were we not the first to advise bringing back our king?” Yet the words of the men of Judah were fiercer than the words of the men of Israel.
Bahnar: Bơngai Isơrael tơl bơngai Juđa: “Lu nhôn hăm hnam pơtao 'bơm hloh kơ lu iĕm mơjĭt wơ̆t, na gah Đawit lu nhôn jê̆ hloh kơ lu iĕm; na liơ mă lu iĕm klai kơ lu nhôn? Lu nhôn boih pơđâu adrol wă sơng pơtao brŏk dah kiơ?” Mă-lei nơ̆r pơma lu bơngai Juđa tơl; oei trăp hloh kơ nơ̆r pơma bơngai Isơrael.

English: And there happened to be there a rebel, whose name was Sheba the son of Bichri, a Benjamite. And he blew a trumpet, and said: “We have no share in David, Nor do we have inheritance in the son of Jesse; Every man to his tents, O Israel!”
Bahnar: Tơ noh đei minh 'nu bơngai pơm pơrŭng, anăn sư Seba, kon drŏ-nglo Bikri, bơngai Bênjamin; Seba hlôm keng păng krao: “Lu bơ̆n ưh kơ đei kiơ gah Đawit, kư̆m ưh kơ đei yua kiơ hăm kon drŏ-nglo Jese! Ơ 'nhŏng oh Isơrael, rim 'nu athei brŏk tơ hnam kơdih”

English: So every man of Israel deserted David, and followed Sheba the son of Bichri. But the men of Judah, from the Jordan as far as Jerusalem, remained loyal to their king.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael achăng lê̆ pơtao Đawit, kiơ̆ Seba kon drŏ-nglo Bikri; mă-lei bơngai Juđa oei kơjăp hăm pơtao sư kơdih, năm kiơ̆ pơtao đơ̆ng đak Krong Jôrđăn brŏk tơ Jêrusalem.

English: Now David came to his house at Jerusalem. And the king took the ten women, his concubines whom he had left to keep the house, and put them in seclusion and supported them, but did not go in to them. So they were shut up to the day of their death, living in widowhood.
Bahnar: Lăp Đawit brŏk tơ hnam pơtao sư tơ pơlei Jêrusalem boih pơtao wơh bơngai chă mơjĭt 'nu akăn kơnhŏng pơtao lê̆ kơ lu sư wei-lăng hnam pơtao ki, pơtao ăn kơ lu sư oei minh pôm hnam đei bơngai wei-lăng; pơtao ăn kơ lu sư tơmam sa mă-lei ưh kơ đei oei hơdai hăm lu sư. Lu sư oei adro adrô̆ klo lu sư oei arih ră; păng chĭt lu sư lăm anih hrĕp truh kơ năr lôch.

English: And the king said to Amasa, “Assemble the men of Judah for me within three days, and be present here yourself.”
Bahnar: Pơtao khan kơ Amasa: “Inh ăn kơ ih lăm pêng năr wă krao akŭm lu linh Juđa năm tơ inh âu.”

English: So Amasa went to assemble the men of Judah. But he delayed longer than the set time which David had appointed him.
Bahnar: Amasa năm krao akŭm lu linh Juđa, mă-lei sư pơhiơ̆, hloh kơ năr pơtao pơkă.

English: And David said to Abishai, “Now Sheba the son of Bichri will do us more harm than Absalom. Take your lord’s servants and pursue him, lest he find for himself fortified cities, and escape us.”
Bahnar: Na, pơtao Đawit khan kơ Abisai: “Seba, kon Bikri, wă pơrăm lu bơ̆n hơmơt hloh kơ Apsalôm. Na ih athei anhăk lu linh inh, druh 'moi Seba kơnh sư tơgar iŏk pơlei ayơ kơjăp đơ̆ng lu bơ̆n.”

English: So Joab’s men, with the Cherethites, the Pelethites, and all the mighty men, went out after him. And they went out of Jerusalem to pursue Sheba the son of Bichri.
Bahnar: Abisai pơgơ̆r linh Jôap, khŭl linh sư bơngai Kêrêthit; păng bơngai Phêlêthit păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai nuih kơtang lĕch dơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem, druh 'moi Sêba, kon Bikri.

English: When they were at the large stone which is in Gibeon, Amasa came before them. Now Joab was dressed in battle armor; on it was a belt with a sword fastened in its sheath at his hips; and as he was going forward, it fell out.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư năm jê̆ tơmo tih tơ pơlei Gibeôn na tơ'bơ̆p Amasa năm tơ lu sư, kơplah noh Jôap hrŭk ao linh; tơ kơiĕng đei kiĕo minh hlak đao gưm tah lăm hơnglop. Lăp sư yak, na đao sư tơgloh đơ̆ng hơnglop.

English: Then Joab said to Amasa, “Are you in health, my brother?” And Joab took Amasa by the beard with his right hand to kiss him.
Bahnar: Jôap kơkuh kơ Amasa. “Ih hăm liĕm akâu?” Ti gah 'ma sư rôp sŏk kang Amasa wă chŭm sư.

English: But Amasa did not notice the sword that was in Joab’s hand. And he struck him with it in the stomach, and his entrails poured out on the ground; and he did not strike him again. Thus he died. Then Joab and Abishai his brother pursued Sheba the son of Bichri.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Amasa ưh kơ đei 'bôh ôh đao tơ ti gah 'ngiĕo Jôap, iŏk đao 'bet hloi klak Amasa, klak Amasa lĕch tơ teh, na sư lôch. Jôap ưh kơ kăl 'bet đơ̆ng mă 'bar. Jôap păng 'nhŏng sư Abisai năm druh 'moi Sêba, kon Bikri dơ̆ng.

English: Meanwhile one of Joab’s men stood near Amasa, and said, “Whoever favors Joab and whoever is for David—follow Joab!”
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai linh Jôap dơ̆ng jê̆ akâu Amasa lôch, khan: “Bơngai bu 'mêm kơ Jôap păng gah Đawit, kiơ̆ Jôap bĕ.”

English: But Amasa wallowed in his blood in the middle of the highway. And when the man saw that all the people stood still, he moved Amasa from the highway to the field and threw a garment over him, when he saw that everyone who came upon him halted.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư 'bôh đĭ-đăng khŭl linh dơ̆ng ngăl, yua kơ akâu Amasa lôch pham lĕch 'bĕnh oei lê̆ tŏk-bŏk trong tih. Sư dui lê̆ akâu noh tơ jih 'nguaih kơ trong tih, đơ̆ng noh sư klă minh blah ao kơpal, yua kơ sư 'bôh bu truh tơ anih noh kư̆m dơ̆ng ngăl.

English: When he was removed from the highway, all the people went on after Joab to pursue Sheba the son of Bichri.
Bahnar: Lăp akâu lôch noh dui lê̆ tơ jih kơ trong tih boih đĭ-đăng bơngai năm kiơ̆ Jôap druh 'moi Sêba, kon Bikri.

English: And he went through all the tribes of Israel to Abel and Beth Maachah and all the Berites. So they were gathered together and also went after Sheba.
Bahnar: Seba năm hlôi jơ̆p kơ tơring lu adrĕch adrung Isơrael. Truh tơ pơlei Abel lăm Bet Maaka păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lăm adrĕch Bikri kư̆m năm kiơ̆ Seba.

English: Then they came and besieged him in Abel of Beth Maachah; and they cast up a siege mound against the city, and it stood by the rampart. And all the people who were with Joab battered the wall to throw it down.
Bahnar: Na, đĭ-đăng lu linh Jôap lu sư truh wang Seba lăm pơlei Abel tơ Bet Maaka, lu sư năm pơm kơđông jê̆ dur 'nguaih păng oei sir wă kơ dur pơlei păk hơlih.

English: Then a wise woman cried out from the city, “Hear, hear! Please say to Joab, ‘Come nearby, that I may speak with you.’ ”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn gơh hơgei dơ̆ng kơpal dur pơlei krao dơ'lông tơ ala: “Mơ̆ng bĕ, mơ̆ng bĕ! Apinh krao Jôap năm jê̆ tơ âu, inh wă pơma dơnuh hăm sư.”

English: When he had come near to her, the woman said, “Are you Joab?” He answered, “I am.” Then she said to him, “Hear the words of your maidservant.” And he answered, “I am listening.”
Bahnar: Lăp Jôap truh jê̆, bơngai drŏ-kăn ei jet: “Ih hăm trŏ kơ Jôap yŏng linh ưh?” Sư tơl: “Inh âu boih.” Drŏ-kăn ei pơma dơ̆ng: “Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r đam drŏ-kăn ih.” Sư tơl: “Inh mơ̆ng âu.”

English: So she spoke, saying, “They used to talk in former times, saying, ‘They shall surely seek guidance at Abel,’ and so they would end disputes.
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn ei khan dơ̆ng: “Kră sơ̆ khan: ‘Athei apinh kon pơlei Abel na gơh keh tơdrong jang.’

English: I am among the peaceable and faithful in Israel. You seek to destroy a city and a mother in Israel. Why would you swallow up the inheritance of the LORD?”
Bahnar: Lu nhôn jơ̆ bơngai oei hiôk-hian păng tơnăp lăm char Isơrael. Mă-lei ih chă đon wă pơrăm lê̆ minh pôm pơlei mĕ lăm Isơrael! Thoi yơ ih mă 'maih pơrăm lê̆ mŭk tơmam Kră Yang?”

English: And Joab answered and said, “Far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or destroy!
Bahnar: Jôap tơl: “Ưh kơ đei layơ! Ưh kơ đei layơ inh mă đei tơchĕng wă pơlôch dah pơrăm lê̆!

English: That is not so. But a man from the mountains of Ephraim, Sheba the son of Bichri by name, has raised his hand against the king, against David. Deliver him only, and I will depart from the city.” So the woman said to Joab, “Watch, his head will be thrown to you over the wall.”
Bahnar: Ưh kơ trŏ thoi noh ôh! Mă-lei đei minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng tơring kông Êphraim, anăn sư Seba, kon drŏ-nglo Bikri. Sư iung blah pơtao Đawit. Lu iĕm athei pơjao sư ăn kơ inh, minh 'nu sư đĕch na inh gô ăn linh kơdŭn weh, ưh pă wang pơlei dơ̆ng.” Bơngai drŏ-kăn tơl: “Lê̆ lu nhôn klơ̆m kơ̆l sư tơ đaih kơ dur ăn kơ ih.”

English: Then the woman in her wisdom went to all the people. And they cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri, and threw it out to Joab. Then he blew a trumpet, and they withdrew from the city, every man to his tent. So Joab returned to the king at Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Na, bơngai drŏ-kăn ei năm tơ'bơ̆p đĭ-đăng kon pơlei păng roi tơbăt tơdrong gơh hơgei sư. Lu sư chơ̆ng kơ̆l Seba, kon drŏ-nglo Bikri klơ̆m ăn kơ Jôap. Jôap hlôm keng hloi; na khŭl linh kơdŭn weh đơ̆ng pơlei păng tơklah lĕch, bu bu brŏk tơ hnam lu sư kơdih. Na Jôap wih brŏk dơ̆ng tơ pơlei Jêrusalem tơbăt ăn kơ pơtao.

English: And Joab was over all the army of Israel; Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites
Bahnar: Jôap pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng lu linh Isơrael; Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada pơm yŏng lu bơngai Kêrêthit păng Pêlêthit

English: Adoram was in charge of revenue; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder
Bahnar: Adôram pôk sư lăng gah tơdrong đe jang; Jêhôsaphat, kon drŏ-nglo Ahilut, pơm yŏng chih răk dôm tơdrong truh.

English: Sheva was scribe; Zadok and Abiathar were the priests
Bahnar: Sêwa pơm bơngai chih hla bơar; Sađŏk păng Abiathar pơm 'bok soi.

English: and Ira the Jairite was a chief minister under David.
Bahnar: Ira bơngai Jair pơm 'bok soi kơ pơtao Đawit.

English: Now there was a famine in the days of David for three years, year after year; and David inquired of the LORD. And the LORD answered, “It is because of Saul and his bloodthirsty house, because he killed the Gibeonites.”
Bahnar: Lăm chăl Đawit đei pơngot rơwĕt tih truh tơ pêng sơnăm. Pơtao Đawit krao apinh Kră Yang; Kră Yang tơl: “Tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt truh yua kơ Sôl păng hnam dơnŏ sư đei hre pham, yua kơ Sôl đei pơlôch lu bơngai Gibeôn.”

English: So the king called the Gibeonites and spoke to them. Now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites; the children of Israel had sworn protection to them, but Saul had sought to kill them in his zeal for the children of Israel and Judah.
Bahnar: Bơngai Gibeôn ưh kơ trŏ gah adrĕch kon pơlei Isơrael, mă-lei lu sư adrĕch Amôrit mă oei oei. Bơngai Isơrael pơkă ưh kơ wă pơlôch lu sư, mă-lei pơtao Sôl yua kơ đei jơhngơ̆m lăp kơ lu adrĕch adrung Isơrael păng Juđa, lei na chă đon pơlôch lu sư. Na pơtao krao akŭm lu bơngai Gibeôn.

English: Therefore David said to the Gibeonites, “What shall I do for you? And with what shall I make atonement, that you may bless the inheritance of the LORD?”
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit apinh bơngai Gibeôn: “Inh athei pơm kiơ kơ lu iĕm? Inh pơm thoi yơ gơh huai iŏk tơdrong đơ̆ng Sôl pơm yoch, wă kơ lu iĕm krao apinh Kră Yang ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ kon pơlei hăm lu tơmam Sư.”

English: And the Gibeonites said to him, “We will have no silver or gold from Saul or from his house, nor shall you kill any man in Israel for us.” So he said, “Whatever you say, I will do for you.”
Bahnar: Bơngai Gibeôn tơl: “Hu maih ưh kơ gơh hơmet tơdrong lu nhôn hăm pơtao Sôl păng adrĕch hnam sư. Na, lu nhôn kư̆m ưh kơ gơh pơlôch bơngai bu lăm kon pơlei Isơrael.” Đawit jet: “Lu iĕm wă apinh mă tơdrong kiơ kiơ, inh gô ăn.”

English: Then they answered the king, “As for the man who consumed us and plotted against us, that we should be destroyed from remaining in any of the territories of Israel
Bahnar: Lu sư tơl pơtao: “Bơngai mă pơlôch lu nhôn boih, păng chă đon wă pơlôch đĭ lu nhôn dơ̆ng, wă kơ lu nhôn ưh pă đei bu oei arih lăm teh đak Isơrael.

English: let seven men of his descendants be delivered to us, and we will hang them before the LORD in Gibeah of Saul, whom the LORD chose.” And the king said, “I will give them.”
Bahnar: Apinh pơtao pơjao ăn kơ lu nhôn tơpơh 'nu kon sâu bơngai noh, wă kơ lu nhôn hrek hơtol lu sư 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, tơ Gibêah, pơlei pơtao Sôl, pơtao mă Kră Yang rơih?” Pơtao tơl: “Inh gô jao lu sư ăn kơ lu iĕm”

English: But the king spared Mephibosheth the son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, because of the LORD’s oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit wei lê̆ Mêphibôset, kon drŏ-nglo Jônathan, sâu tơm pơtao Sôl, yua kơ đei nơ̆r pơkă hăm Kră Yang gah bre pơtao Đawit hăm Jônathan, kon drŏ-nglo pơtao Sôl.

English: So the king took Armoni and Mephibosheth, the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bore to Saul, and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she brought up for Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite
Bahnar: Mă-lei Đawit rôp jao Armôni păng Mephibôset, 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo mă yă Rispa, kon drŏ-kăn Aiyah, tơpŭ ăn kơ pơtao Sôl; pơtao kư̆m rôp pơđăm 'nu kon drŏ-nglo yă Mêrap kon drŏ-kăn Sôl, 'bă lu sư noh Adriel, kon Barsilai, bơngai Mêhôlat.

English: and he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them on the hill before the LORD. So they fell, all seven together, and were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, in the beginning of barley harvest.
Bahnar: Pơtao pơjao lu sư kơ bơngai Gibeôn. Lu sư hrek hơtol lu đe noh tơ kơpal groi, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, tơpơh 'nu bơngai noh lôch hơdai minh 'măng. Đe pơlôch lu sư trŏ kơ năr bơyan yuă 'ba blŭng-a, lăp đe 'nao yuă 'ba tơ'bâu.

English: Now Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth and spread it for herself on the rock, from the beginning of harvest until the late rains poured on them from heaven. And she did not allow the birds of the air to rest on them by day nor the beasts of the field by night.
Bahnar: Yă Rispa kon drŏ-kăn Aiya, iŏk minh blah 'bi lơ̆k kơpal tơmo, păng yă ei oei tơ noh đơ̆ng bơyan yuă blŭng truh tơ đei 'mi đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh jruh tơ kơpal akâu lu bơngai lôch. Kơ'năr yă ei ưh kơ ăn sem păr jruh kơpal akâu bơngai lôch, kơmăng yă ei ưh kơ ăn sem bri năm jê̆.

English: And David was told what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.
Bahnar: Đei bơngai tơbăt ăn kơ pơtao Đawit dôm tơdrong yă Rispa, kon drŏ-kăn Aiya, akăn kơnhŏng pơtao Sôl, đei pơm.

English: Then David went and took the bones of Saul, and the bones of Jonathan his son, from the men of Jabesh Gilead who had stolen them from the street of Beth Shan, where the Philistines had hung them up, after the Philistines had struck down Saul in Gilboa.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit năm tơ'bơ̆p lu bơngai pơgơ̆r lăm pơlei Jabes tơ Gileat wă apinh iŏk kơting pơtao Sôl păng kơting Jônathan kon drŏ-nglo pơtao. Lu bơngai 'nâu iŏk tơtông boih akâu 'bar 'nu. 'Bă hăm kon sư dơ̆ng linh Philistin hơtol sư tơ anih Bêtsan đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu sư pơlôch pơtao Sôl tơ kơpal Kông Gilbôa.

English: So he brought up the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from there; and they gathered the bones of those who had been hanged.
Bahnar: Pơtao chĕp ba kơting pơtao Sôl păng kơting Jônathan kon pơtao, đơ̆ng Jabes, đơ̆ng noh wơh lu bơngai năm iŏk kơting lu bơngai mă đe hrek hơtol noh.

English: They buried the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son in the country of Benjamin in Zelah, in the tomb of Kish his father. So they performed all that the king commanded. And after that God heeded the prayer for the land.
Bahnar: Chĕp ba 'bŭ hơdai hăm kơting pơtao Sôl păng Jônathan kon pơtao, tơ Sêla lăm teh đak Bênjamin lăm bơsat Kis 'bă pơtao Sôl. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu sư jang keh dôm tơdrong pơtao pơkă, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơl tơwih nơ̆r pơtao krao apinh păng tuh tơdrong pŭn hiôk ăn kơ teh đak.

English: When the Philistines were at war again with Israel, David and his servants with him went down and fought against the Philistines; and David grew faint.
Bahnar: Bơngai Philistin đei tơblah hăm kon pơlei Isơrael dơ̆ng. Pơtao Đawit kơdih sư pơgơ̆r lu linh năm jur tơblah hăm lu bơngai Philistin. Kơplah oei tơblah, pơtao mơn lăm akâu sư lap rơmơ̆n dêh.

English: Then Ishbi-Benob, who was one of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose bronze spear was three hundred shekels, who was bearing a new sword, thought he could kill David.
Bahnar: Isbi Benop minh 'nu bơngai Philistin gah adrĕch adrung bơngai Rapha tih kơjung đei tơju pơm păng kong trăp pêng kĭ minh puăt, păng kiĕo đao 'nao tơ kơiĕng, wă pơlôch pơtao Đawit.

English: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah came to his aid, and struck the Philistine and killed him. Then the men of David swore to him, saying, “You shall go out no more with us to battle, lest you quench the lamp of Israel.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Abisai, kon yă Sêruia năm dŏng pơtao, blah bơngai Philistin 'noh păng pơlôch lê̆ lu sư. Kơplah noh lu linh pơtao Đawit pơkă: “Pơtao ih 'nĕ pă lĕch tơblah hơdai lu nhôn dơ̆ng, kơnh pơtao pĭt hŭt pla ŭnh kơđeng kon pơlei Isơrael.”

English: Now it happened afterward that there was again a battle with the Philistines at Gob. Then Sibbechai the Hushathite killed Saph, who was one of the sons of the giant.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh, tơdrong tơblah truh dơ̆ng hăm bơngai Philistin tơ pơlei Gop, kơplah noh Sibêkai, bơngai Husa, pơlôch Sap bơngai tih kơjung gah adrĕch adrung bơngai Rapha.

English: Again there was war at Gob with the Philistines, where Elhanan the son of Jaare-Oregim the Bethlehemite killed the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
Bahnar: Tơblah minh 'măng nai dơ̆ng hăm bơngai Philistin kư̆m tơ pơlei Gop, Êlhanan kon drŏ-nglo Jaar Ôregim bơngai Betlehem, pơlôch Gôliat, bơngai pơlei Gat; đei tơju gơ̆r tih thoi 'long không đe tanh brai.

English: Yet again there was war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature, who had six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot, twenty-four in number; and he also was born to the giant.
Bahnar: Tơdrong tơblah đei truh dơ̆ng tơ pơlei Gat, tơ noh đei minh 'nu bơngai tih kơjung, jơ̆ng ti sư tă kơ đei tơdrâu tŏ hơnglâu ngăl, đĭ-đăng sư đei 'bar-jĭt puăn tŏ hơnglâu; bơngai 'nâu kư̆m adrĕch adrung bơngai Rapha.

English: So when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea, David’s brother, killed him.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'nâu pơma hơno hăm kon pơlei Isơrael; mă-lei Jônathan, kon drŏ-nglo Simêi 'nhŏng pơtao Đawit pơlôch sư.

English: These four were born to the giant in Gath, and fell by the hand of David and by the hand of his servants.
Bahnar: Puăn 'nu mă roi tơ kơpal âu, tă kơ gah adrĕch adrung bơngai Rapha, pơlei Gat. Lu sư tă kơ lôch kơ ti pơtao Đawit păng khŭl linh sư.

English: Then David spoke to the LORD the words of this song, on the day when the LORD had delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang lu nơ̆r hơri 'nâu, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih sư đơ̆ng ti bơngai ayăt păng đơ̆ng ti pơtao Sôl.

English: And he said: “The LORD is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer
Bahnar: Pơtao hơri: “Kră Yang jơ̆ kông tơmo păng kơđông kơjăp inh, Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih inh!

English: The God of my strength, in whom I will trust; My shield and the horn of my salvation, My stronghold and my refuge; My Savior, You save me from violence.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆ kông tơmo anih inh gơnang jơ̆ khêl pĕng inh, hơke dŏng pơklaih inh, hnam Thôt kơjung kơjăp anih inh kơ'nơp; Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih! Ih boih dŏng inh đơ̆ng bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised; So shall I be saved from my enemies.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, inh hơri ư-ang kơ ih; inh krao apinh Ih, na inh gơh klaih đơ̆ng lu bơngai ayăt kơ inh.

English: “When the waves of death surrounded me, The floods of ungodliness made me afraid.
Bahnar: Tơdrong lôch thoi đak dơsĭ poh-yă wang tăp dăr kơ inh, tơdrong lôch thoi chơkơi đak huơ̆r pơdăr răp lê̆ tơ noh boih.

English: The sorrows of Sheol surrounded me; The snares of death confronted me.
Bahnar: Tơlei anih lôch wăr tăp kơ inh, hơđong tơdrong lôch oei răp inh.

English: In my distress I called upon the LORD, And cried out to my God; He heard my voice from His temple, And my cry entered His ears.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong truh pơmat inh krao apinh Kră Yang. Inh ôr krao Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, đơ̆ng anih hnam Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r inh krao ôr, Ih pơgling đon mơ̆ng inh krao apinh.

English: “Then the earth shook and trembled; The foundations of heaven quaked and were shaken, Because He was angry.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh teh adrŏ kyĭng kyơ̆ng, hơnă lu plĕnh kư̆m adrŏ gĭl-gŭl, yua kơ Kră Yang hil mĭl.

English: Smoke went up from His nostrils, And devouring fire from His mouth; Coals were kindled by it.
Bahnar: 'Nhui lĕch đơ̆ng trôm muh Kră Yang, 'bơ̆r Kră Yang bluh pla ŭnh soh chhông ngar ngŭr khơ̆ng.

English: He bowed the heavens also, and came down With darkness under His feet.
Bahnar: Kră Yang hek lu plĕnh, jur tơ ala. Jơ̆ng juă kơpal hơmơ̆l găm hơ'bơ̆l.

English: He rode upon a cherub, and flew; And He was seen upon the wings of the wind.
Bahnar: Kră Yang hao kơpal chêrubim na păr, 'bôh Sư tơ kơpal jơwa pơnăr kial.

English: He made darkness canopies around Him, Dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.
Bahnar: Kră Yang dăng măng mu tăp kơ Sư, hơmơ̆l 'mi găm hơ'bơ̆l đơ̆ng plĕnh klơ̆p lê̆ Sư.

English: From the brightness before Him Coals of fire were kindled.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lăm rang mơnhal 'bơ̆t anăp Sư. Lĕch hloi đei 'mi prĕl păng ngar ngŭr.

English: “The LORD thundered from heaven, And the Most High uttered His voice.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn grơ̆m glaih kơpal plĕnh. Nơ̆r re jơwa đơ̆ng Tơ'ngla Kơjung hloh kơ đĭ-đăng.

English: He sent out arrows and scattered them; Lightning bolts, and He vanquished them.
Bahnar: Kră Yang prah 'brơ̆m, lu ayăt kơ inh kơdâu bru bra, tơlĕch kơmlat chêr 'blêt pơm kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang.

English: Then the channels of the sea were seen, The foundations of the world were uncovered, At the rebuke of the LORD, At the blast of the breath of His nostrils.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang chrih hiap kơđĕl đak dơsĭ 'bôh tơ 'nguaih, bluh kial đơ̆ng trôm muh, hơnă teh 'bôh bang.

English: “He sent from above, He took me, He drew me out of many waters.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng plĕnh kơjung Kră Yang chro ti rôp iŏk inh, dui hơtŏk inh đơ̆ng đak jrŭ.

English: He delivered me from my strong enemy, From those who hated me; For they were too strong for me.
Bahnar: Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng lu bơngai ayăt pơm kơtang dêh. Hlôi kơ đơ̆ng lu bơngai areh kơ inh, yua kơ lu sư pran hloh kơ inh.

English: They confronted me in the day of my calamity, But the LORD was my support.
Bahnar: Lăm năr truh kơ inh pơmat-tat lu sư bruh tơ inh. Mă-lei Kră Yang dŏng tơgŭm inh.

English: He also brought me out into a broad place; He delivered me because He delighted in me.
Bahnar: Kră Yang dui anhăk inh lĕch tơ anih rơhơi, Sư dŏng pơklaih inh yua kơ Sư 'mêm kơ inh.

English: “The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness; According to the cleanness of my hands He has recompensed me.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei apah inh kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng inh. Kră Yang tơwih kơ inh kiơ̆ kơ đêl ti inh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: For I have kept the ways of the LORD, And have not wickedly departed from my God.
Bahnar: Inh wei răk kiơ̆ trong Kră Yang bơtho. Ưh kơ đei pơm kơnê̆ achăng lê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh.

English: For all His judgments were before me; And as for His statutes, I did not depart from them.
Bahnar: Yua kơ dôm tơdrong juăt Kră Yang tơtă oei 'bơ̆t anăp inh. Inh ưh kơ weh đơ̆ng tơdrong juăt Sư.

English: I was also blameless before Him, And I kept myself from my iniquity.
Bahnar: Kră Yang băt kơ inh chu kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong Sư. Păng inh bơwei akâu kơdih ưh kơ pơm kơnê̆.

English: Therefore the LORD has recompensed me according to my righteousness, According to my cleanness in His eyes.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang tuh tơdrong pŭn hiôk ăn kơ inh, yua kơ inh chu yom nơ̆r Sư, yua kơ Kră Yang băt kơ inh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: “With the merciful You will show Yourself merciful; With a blameless man You will show Yourself blameless
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei jơhngơ̆m 'mêm mơnat kơ bơngai ayơ mă tơnăp chu yom nơ̆r Sư. Kră Yang pơm 'lơ̆ng tôm tơdrong kơ bơngai chu kiơ̆ Sư.

English: With the pure You will show Yourself pure; And with the devious You will show Yourself shrewd.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hăm lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Mă-lei Kră Yang wă phak lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong jang lu sư pơm.

English: You will save the humble people; But Your eyes are on the haughty, that You may bring them down.
Bahnar: Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih lu bơngai iŏk đon ala kơ đe. Mă-lei măt Sư 'bôh lu bơngai pơang, Kră Yang gô tơjur lu sư.

English: “For You are my lamp, O LORD; The LORD shall enlighten my darkness.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Ih jơ̆ ŭnh kơđeng inh, pơchrang lăm jơhngơ̆m inh puh tơweh lê̆ măng mu tơdrong yoch păng tơdrong lôch.

English: For by You I can run against a troop; By my God I can leap over a wall.
Bahnar: Hăm jơhngơ̆m pran Ih inh blah drŭt lu ayăt, gơnang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh plŏng hlôi kơ dur pơlei.

English: As for God, His way is perfect; The word of the LORD is proven; He is a shield to all who trust in Him.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, trong Ih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt; Nơ̆r Kră Yang pơkă trŏ kơ lui ngeh tơpă. Kră Yang jơ̆ khêl pĕng lu bơngai ôn kơ'nơp lăm Sư.

English: “For who is God, except the LORD? And who is a rock, except our God?
Bahnar: 'Nguaih kơ Kră Yang, bu dơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei? Bu thoi tơmo tih, 'nguaih kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn mă kơkuh?

English: God is my strength and power, And He makes my way perfect.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih boih anih inh ôn kơjăp, Ih wei inh yak năm hơđơ̆ng.

English: He makes my feet like the feet of deer, And sets me on my high places.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kơ jơ̆ng inh hơbĕch hơbal thoi jơ̆ng juei. Kră Yang dan inh dơ̆ng kơjăp kơpal kơ̆l kông.

English: He teaches my hands to make war, So that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơjuăt ti inh gơh tơblah tơpang ti inh kĕ gŭt hră kong.

English: “You have also given me the shield of Your salvation; Your gentleness has made me great.
Bahnar: Kră Yang thoi khêl dŏng pơklaih inh; Kră Yang tơjur akâu Sư tơ ala wă hơtŏk inh tơ kơpal.

English: You enlarged my path under me; So my feet did not slip.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơih trong să ăn kơ inh nơnăm. Na inh ưh kơ đei kơtơih pơ̆k.

English: “I have pursued my enemies and destroyed them; Neither did I turn back again till they were destroyed.
Bahnar: Inh druh pơrăm khŭl ayăt, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ pơlôch lê̆ lu sư 'mơ̆i na inh gơh brŏk.

English: And I have destroyed them and wounded them, So that they could not rise; They have fallen under my feet.
Bahnar: Inh pơlôch đĭ lu sư teh pơrăm lê̆ lu sư. Lu sư ưh kơ kĕ kơ iung dơ̆ng lu sư pơ̆k 'bơ̆t ala jơ̆ng inh.

English: For You have armed me with strength for the battle; You have subdued under me those who rose against me.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kơ inh đei jơhngơ̆m pran wă tơblah. Kră Yang pơm ăn kơ bơngai ayăt pơtăm kŭl-tăng drap ala jơ̆ng inh.

English: You have also given me the necks of my enemies, So that I destroyed those who hated me.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm ăn kơ bơngai ayăt tơwih rŏng kơdâu ôn, Inh pơlôch lu bơngai ayăt kơ inh.

English: They looked, but there was none to save; Even to the LORD, but He did not answer them.
Bahnar: Lu sư krao ôr wă kơ dŏng, mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu dŏng tơgŭm, Lu sư krao chă Kră Yang mă-lei Kră Yang ưh kơ đei tơl nơ̆r.

English: Then I beat them as fine as the dust of the earth; I trod them like dirt in the streets, And I spread them out.
Bahnar: Inh teh pơhĕch lu sư thoi 'mui teh, Inh pơjuă păng juă bơhlơ̆r lu sư hĕch thoi teh rơpŭk rok trong.

English: “You have also delivered me from the strivings of my people; You have kept me as the head of the nations. A people I have not known shall serve me.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei blah plơ̆ inh, Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng tơdrong noh. Ih dan inh pơm kơ̆l kơ lu teh đak, kon pơlei mă inh ưh kơ băt noh, chu yom kơ inh.

English: The foreigners submit to me; As soon as they hear, they obey me.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai dêh char 'nguaih drap 'bơ̆t anăp inh. Lăp kơtơ̆ng roi gah inh, lu sư chu kiơ̆ hloi.

English: The foreigners fade away, And come frightened from their hideouts.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai dêh char 'nguaih hiong đĭ jơhngơ̆m pran, Đơ̆ng lăm kơđông kơjăp hli tơtơ̆ kơdâu lĕch tơ 'nguaih.

English: “The LORD lives! Blessed be my Rock! Let God be exalted, The Rock of my salvation!
Bahnar: Kră Yang mă arih ling-lang! Inh hơri ư-ang kơ ih jơ̆ tơmo tih anih mă inh kơ'nơp! Inh ư-ang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih boih tơmo tih pĕng inh, Ih dŏng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng tơdrong hli krưp!

English: It is God who avenges me, And subdues the peoples under me
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih boih Tơ'ngla blah 'mong tang inh, Ih pơm ăn kơ kon pơlei chu yom kơ inh.

English: He delivers me from my enemies. You also lift me up above those who rise against me; You have delivered me from the violent man.
Bahnar: Ih dŏng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng lu bơngai ayăt, ăn kơ inh kĕ jei blah lu bơngai ayăt. Dŏng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: Therefore I will give thanks to You, O LORD, among the Gentiles, And sing praises to Your name.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh, ơ Kră Yang, inh apinh ư-ang kơ Ih lăm kon pơlei pơla, păng hơri ư-ang kơ anăn Ih.

English: “He is the tower of salvation to His king, And shows mercy to His anointed, To David and his descendants forevermore.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn tơdrong kĕ jei jơnei tih kơ pơtao mă Ih đei rơih iŏk. Kră Yang 'mêm kơ bơngai mă Kră Yang ăn kơ đe tuh đak pơgang 'bâu phu noh tơdrong 'mêm kơjăp, ưh kơ đei tơplih. Kră Yang 'mêm kơ Đawit păng adrĕch adrung sư, ling-lang ưh kơ đei layơ tôch.”

English: Now these are the last words of David. Thus says David the son of Jesse; Thus says the man raised up on high, The anointed of the God of Jacob, And the sweet psalmist of Israel
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih lu nơ̆r pơtao Đawit pơma tuch-luch: Nơ̆r Đawit kon Jese nơ̆r mă bơngai đe pôk atŏk kơjung, mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp tuh đak pơgang 'bâu phu pôk ăn tơdrong jang; sư chă nơ̆r lu tơdrong hơri đei kon pơlei Isơrael lăp đon.

English: “The Spirit of the LORD spoke by me, And His word was on my tongue.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Kră Yang yua inh pơma bơtho. Nơ̆r Sư lăm hơpiĕt inh.

English: The God of Israel said, The Rock of Israel spoke to me: ‘He who rules over men must be just, Ruling in the fear of God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kon pơlei Isơrael bơtho tơ'bôh. Tơmo tih kon pơlei Isơrael pơma hăm inh: “Bơngai ayơ pơgơ̆r kon bơngai mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, bơngai ayơ pơgơ̆r hăm jơhngơ̆m hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And he shall be like the light of the morning when the sun rises, A morning without clouds, Like the tender grass springing out of the earth, By clear shining after rain.’
Bahnar: Gô thoi lĕ hơdah pơchrang til pơgê, kơplah măt năr lĕch. Thoi lĕ til pơgê hrôih ưh kơ đei hơmơ̆l, pơchrang hơdah đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'mi. Pơm ăn kơ 'nhĕt 'long chăt arih đơ̆ng lăm teh.”

English: “Although my house is not so with God, Yet He has made with me an everlasting covenant, Ordered in all things and secure. For this is all my salvation and all my desire; Will He not make it increase?
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sĭt gô tuh ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ adrĕch adrung inh thoi noh! Yua kơ Sư đei pơjing boih hăm inh tơdrong pơgơ̆p khŏm khŏm. Tơdrong đei pơkă tôm, ưh kơ đei tơplih dôm tơdrong inh hơpơi, sư gô ăn tơdrong noh bluh chăt.

English: But the sons of rebellion shall all be as thorns thrust away, Because they cannot be taken with hands.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu khŭl bơngai kơnê̆, đĭ-đăng lu sư tă kơ buch hŭt lê̆ thoi lĕ tơm jơla ưh kơ đei bơngai bu pơ̆n kơđôp lu sư lăm tơpang ti.

English: But the man who touches them Must be armed with iron and the shaft of a spear, And they shall be utterly burned with fire in their place.”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hơtŭt 'bơm lu sư, athei đei tơmam hăm bơsei, dah 'long, tơju. Ŭnh sa lu sư lek hach kơtă anih noh hloi.

English: These are the names of the mighty men whom David had: Josheb-Basshebeth the Tachmonite, chief among the captains. He was called Adino the Eznite, because he had killed eight hundred men at one time.
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu bơngai nuih kơtang Đawit: Jôsep Basêbêt, bơngai Tahkêmôn, chĕp kơ̆l lu bơngai nuih kơtang. Đe kư̆m krao sư Ađinô, bơngai Êsen, sư pơlôch tơhngam-hrĕng 'nu bơngai lăm minh 'măng.

English: And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, one of the three mighty men with David when they defied the Philistines who were gathered there for battle, and the men of Israel had retreated.
Bahnar: Lăm pêng 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang đei Êlêasar kon Đôđô, bơngai Ahôhi. Sư kiơ̆ pơtao Đawit kơplah lu sư tơdơ̆ng băl hăm kon pơlei Philistin akŭm băl tơ noh wă tơblah. Linh Isơrael kơdŭn tơ rŏng.

English: He arose and attacked the Philistines until his hand was weary, and his hand stuck to the sword. The LORD brought about a great victory that day; and the people returned after him only to plunder.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư dơ̆ng kơtă anih păng koh pơlôch kon pơlei Philistin truh tơpang ti sư rơgah hơmren klep kơjăp kơ đao gưm, khŭl linh Isơrael wih hơlơ̆k tơgŭm sư, mă-lei lăp chă dônh akŭm tơmam đơ̆ng akâu bơngai lôch đĕch. Lăm năr noh, Kră Yang ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael kĕ jei jơnei tih.

English: And after him was Shammah the son of Agee the Hararite. The Philistines had gathered together into a troop where there was a piece of ground full of lentils. So the people fled from the Philistines.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư đei Samma, kon Agê bơngai Hara. Linh Philistin akŭm tơ pơlei Lêhi. Tơ noh đei minh hlak mir pơtăm tơh. Linh Isơrael kơdâu ôn kơ linh Philistin.

English: But he stationed himself in the middle of the field, defended it, and killed the Philistines. So the LORD brought about a great victory.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư dơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk lăm mir blah pơlôch linh Philistin păng bơwei mir tơh. Kră Yang ăn kơ linh Isơrael kĕ jei jơnei tih.

English: Then three of the thirty chief men went down at harvest time and came to David at the cave of Adullam. And the troop of Philistines encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.
Bahnar: Pêng 'nu bơngai lăm khŭl pêng-jĭt 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang, lu sư năm jur tơ hơgơp tơmo Ađulam lăm bơyan yuă 'ba wă tơ'bơ̆p pơtao Đawit. Minh khŭl linh Philistin pơm kơđông dơ̆ng tơ lăm thŭng Rêphaim.

English: David was then in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.
Bahnar: Lu sư blah iŏk boih pơlei Betlehem. Kơplah noh, pơtao Đawit oei tơ lăm anih ôn kơ'nơp.

English: And David said with longing, “Oh, that someone would give me a drink of the water from the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!”
Bahnar: Pơtao 'blŏk tơ hnam păng khan: “Rŏ kơ đei bơngai bu ăn kơ inh nhă đak sŏ iŏk đơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei Betlehem!

English: So the three mighty men broke through the camp of the Philistines, drew water from the well of Bethlehem that was by the gate, and took it and brought it to David. Nevertheless he would not drink it, but poured it out to the LORD.
Bahnar: Na pêng 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang năm mơ̆t tơ lăm kơđông linh Philistin, sŏ iŏk đak đơ̆ng sơlŭng jê̆ 'măng jang pơlei Betlehem, chĕp ba ăn kơ Đawit. Mă-lei pơtao sơngah ưh kơ nhă. Pơtao tuh hŭt lê̆ păng pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: And he said, “Far be it from me, O LORD, that I should do this! Is this not the blood of the men who went in jeopardy of their lives?” Therefore he would not drink it. These things were done by the three mighty men.
Bahnar: Pơtao khan: “Kơkuh kơ Ih Kră Yang, apinh ih 'nĕ ăn kơ kon nhă đak noh, yua kơ 'nâu jơ̆ pham lu bơngai hŭt akâu sư kơdih năm sŏ iŏk na brŏk ăn kơ kon.” Na pơtao sơngah ưh kơ nhă đak noh. 'Noh jơ̆ jơnei tih lu pêng 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang.

English: Now Abishai the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief of another three. He lifted his spear against three hundred men, killed them, and won a name among these three.
Bahnar: Abisai 'nhŏng Jôap kon Sêruia, pơm yŏng lu bơngai nuih kơtang sư hiŏng tơju 'bet pơlôch pêng-hrĕng 'nu bơngai, na đei anăn lăm pêng 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang.

English: Was he not the most honored of three? Therefore he became their captain. However, he did not attain to the first three.
Bahnar: Sư đei anăn pơyom hloh lăm khŭl pêng-jĭt 'nu, păng pơgơ̆r lu sư, mă-lei ưh kơ gơh jô̆ mơ̆t lăm pêng 'nu bơngai noh.

English: Benaiah was the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man from Kabzeel, who had done many deeds. He had killed two lion-like heroes of Moab. He also had gone down and killed a lion in the midst of a pit on a snowy day.
Bahnar: Bênaia, kon Jêhôiada, đơ̆ng pơlei Kapsêl, minh 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang, đei lơ jơnei tih, sư boih pơlôch 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Ariêl, bơngai Môap sư boih kư̆m jur tơ lăm sơlŭng pơlôch minh pôm dăm-brang lăm minh năr prĕl jur.

English: And he killed an Egyptian, a spectacular man. The Egyptian had a spear in his hand; so he went down to him with a staff, wrested the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.
Bahnar: Sư boih kư̆m pơlôch minh 'nu bơngai Êyiptơ tih kơjung. Bơngai Êyiptơ chĕp tơju kơplah noh Bênaia lăp đei 'long jra, sư rôp hơđuh iŏk tơju đơ̆ng ti bơngai Êyiptơ păng iŏk tơju bơngai noh na pơlôch bơngai noh.

English: These things Benaiah the son of Jehoiada did, and won a name among three mighty men.
Bahnar: Bênaia, kon Jêhôiada, đei lơ jơnei tih noh na sư đei anăn lăm khŭl pêng 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang.

English: He was more honored than the thirty, but he did not attain to the first three. And David appointed him over his guard.
Bahnar: Sư đei anăn pơyom hloh kơ khŭl pêng-jĭt 'nu bơngai, mă-lei ưh kơ gơh jô̆ mơ̆t lăm pêng 'nu bơngai noh, Đawit pôk sư pơgơ̆r khŭl linh.

English: Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty; Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem
Bahnar: Lăm khŭl pêng-jĭt 'nu đei: Asahel oh Jôap; Êlhanan kon drŏ-nglo Đôđô đơ̆ng pơlei Betlehem

English: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite
Bahnar: Samma đơ̆ng pơlei Harôt; Êlika kư̆m đơ̆ng pơlei Harôt

English: Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite
Bahnar: Hêlês bơngai Paltit; Ira kon Ikês đơ̆ng pơlei Têkôa.

English: Abiezer the Anathothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite
Bahnar: Abiêse đơ̆ng pơlei Anathôt; Nêbunai đơ̆ng pơlei Husa

English: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite
Bahnar: Salmôn, adrĕch adrung Ahôhi; Maharai đơ̆ng pơlei Nettôpha

English: Heleb the son of Baanah (the Netophathite), Ittai the son of Ribai from Gibeah of the children of Benjamin
Bahnar: Hêlep kon Baanah đơ̆ng pơlei Nettôpha. Itai kon Ribai đơ̆ng pơlei Gibêah gah teh đak Bênjamin

English: Benaiah a Pirathonite, Hiddai from the brooks of Gaash
Bahnar: Bênaia đơ̆ng pơlei Phirathôn; Hiđai đơ̆ng thong đak Gaas

English: Abi-Albon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite
Bahnar: Abialbôn bơngai Arba; Asmawet, đơ̆ng pơlei Bahurim

English: Eliahba the Shaalbonite (of the sons of Jashen), Jonathan
Bahnar: Aliaba đơ̆ng pơlei Saalbôn, kon Jasen

English: Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam the son of Sharar the Hararite
Bahnar: Jônathan kon Samma bơngai Hara; Ahiam kon Sarar, bơngai Hararit

English: Eliphelet the son of Ahasbai, the son of the Maachathite, Eliam the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite
Bahnar: Êliphêlet, kon Ahasbai đơ̆ng pơlei Maaka; Êliam, kon Ahithôphel đơ̆ng pơlei Gilô

English: Hezrai the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite
Bahnar: Hêsrô đơ̆ng kông Karmel, Paarai bơngai Albit

English: Igal the son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani the Gadite
Bahnar: Igai kon drŏ-nglo Nathan đơ̆ng pơlei Sôba; Bani bơngai Gat; (kon Hagri)

English: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite (armorbearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah)
Bahnar: Sêlek bơngai Ammôn; Naharai đơ̆ng pơlei Bêrôt, bơngai chĕp kơ Jôap tơmam tơblah kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia.

English: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite
Bahnar: Ira bơngai Ithrit, Garet kư̆m bơngai Ithrit.

English: and Uriah the Hittite: thirty-seven in all.
Bahnar: Uria bơngai Hêtit. Đĭ-đăng pêng-jĭt tơpơh 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang.

English: Again the anger of the LORD was aroused against Israel, and He moved David against them to say, “Go, number Israel and Judah.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang hil dơ̆ng kơ kon pơlei Isơrael. Kră Yang pơdrŭt pơtao Đawit pơrăm lu sư, Sư khan hăm pơtao Đawit: “Athei năm jô̆ kon pơlei Isơrael păng kon pơlei Juđa.”

English: So the king said to Joab the commander of the army who was with him, “Now go throughout all the tribes of Israel, from Dan to Beersheba, and count the people, that I may know the number of the people.”
Bahnar: Pơtao athei Jôap, yŏng pơgơ̆r linh, oei hơdai hăm pơtao: “Athei năm jô̆ bơngai jơ̆p kơ lu adrĕch adrung Isơrael, iŏk đơ̆ng pơlei Đan gah yă-nơ̆m truh tơ Bêrsêba tơ gah gơal, roi ăn kơ inh băt đĭ-đăng kon pơlei lăm lu sơnăm oei gơh pơm linh dôm yơ.”

English: And Joab said to the king, “Now may the LORD your God add to the people a hundred times more than there are, and may the eyes of my lord the king see it. But why does my lord the king desire this thing?”
Bahnar: Jôap tơl: “Apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, ăn kơ ih đei minh khŭl linh tơpôl lơ hloh kơ hrĕng wơ̆t khŭl linh mă đei dang ei. Apinh ăn kơ măt ih kơdih yŏng tơ'ngla inh gơh 'bôh tơdrong noh. Mă-lei liơ pơtao yŏng tơ'ngla inh 'maih pơm tơdrong 'nâu?”

English: Nevertheless the king’s word prevailed against Joab and against the captains of the army. Therefore Joab and the captains of the army went out from the presence of the king to count the people of Israel.
Bahnar: Lei ră nơ̆r pơtao pơkă, ưh kơ đei tơplih, na Jôap păng lu yŏng linh, khŏm athei năm jô̆ kơ̆l kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak Isơrael.

English: And they crossed over the Jordan and camped in Aroer, on the right side of the town which is in the midst of the ravine of Gad, and toward Jazer.
Bahnar: Lu sư năm tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn păng pơtơm jô̆ bơngai iŏk đơ̆ng pơlei Arôe, păng minh pôm pơlei oei lăm thŭng, na tŏk tơ tơring Gat truh tơ pơlei Jaser.

English: Then they came to Gilead and to the land of Tahtim Hodshi; they came to Dan Jaan and around to Sidon
Bahnar: Lu sư truh tơ tơring Gileat, năm rok tơpăt hlôi kơ teh đak bơngai Tahtim, truh tơ pơlei Hôsi pơlei Đan Jaan đơ̆ng noh dăr brŏk tơ pơlei Siđôn.

English: and they came to the stronghold of Tyre and to all the cities of the Hivites and the Canaanites. Then they went out to South Judah as far as Beersheba.
Bahnar: Lu sư năm truh tơ pơlei Tirơ, minh pôm pơlei tih kơjăp, păng năm jơ̆p kơ pơlei bơngai Hêwit păng bơngai Kanaan. Tuch-luch, lu sư năm truh tơ pơlei Bêrsêba gah tơring teh glă gah gơal lăm dêh Juđa.

English: So when they had gone through all the land, they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.
Bahnar: Lu sư brŏk truh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem đơ̆ng rŏng kơ năm jơ̆p teh đak hiong tơsĭn khei 'bar-jĭt năr.

English: Then Joab gave the sum of the number of the people to the king. And there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men who drew the sword, and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men.
Bahnar: Jôap tơbăt ăn kơ pơtao tơdrong jô̆ kơ̆l bơngai Isơrael đei tơhngam-hrĕng rơbâu 'nu bơngai linh tơblah gơh hơgei chĕp đao, păng lăm Juđa đei pơđăm-hrĕng rơbâu 'nu.

English: And David’s heart condemned him after he had numbered the people. So David said to the LORD, “I have sinned greatly in what I have done; but now, I pray, O LORD, take away the iniquity of Your servant, for I have done very foolishly.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ jô̆ kơ̆l kon bơngai đang boih, pơtao Đawit jơhngơ̆m sư ưh kơ hiôk păng khan kơ Kră Yang: “Kơkuh kơ Ih Kră Yang, inh đei pơm boih minh tơdrong kơtul bơlŭk păng yoch trăp. Dang ei inh apinh Kră Yang mơnat ăn kơ inh đĭch đam Ih.”

English: Now when David arose in the morning, the word of the LORD came to the prophet Gad, David’s seer, saying
Bahnar: Pơgê năr đơ̆ng rŏng adrol kơ pơtao Đawit hơđơ̆r, Kră Yang khan kơ Gat bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, sư bơ̆jang lăm hnam pơtao Đawit

English: “Go and tell David, ‘Thus says the LORD: “I offer you three things; choose one of them for yourself, that I may do it to you.” ’ ”
Bahnar: “Ih athei năm khan kơ Đawit: ‘Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Inh đei pêng tơdrong wă hơmet ih. Inh ăn kơ ih rơih iŏk minh lăm pêng tơdrong noh, Inh gô kiơ̆ kơ noh na hơmet ih.’ ”

English: So Gad came to David and told him; and he said to him, “Shall seven years of famine come to you in your land? Or shall you flee three months before your enemies, while they pursue you? Or shall there be three days’ plague in your land? Now consider and see what answer I should take back to Him who sent me.”
Bahnar: Gat bơngai khan lê̆ adrol năm roi ăn kơ pơtao Đawit. Bơngai khan lê̆ adrol apinh pơtao: “Pơtao rơih iŏk tơdrong ayơ: Tơpơh sơnăm pơngot rơwĕt jơ̆p-jang kơ lăm teh đak pơtao, dah pêng khei pơtao athei kơdâu ôn lăm kơplah ayăt oei druh pơtao, dah pêng năr đei tơdrong jĭ hơbuh tơ jơ̆p-jang teh đak? Dang ei apinh ih athei tơchĕng lăng mă hơlen, wă kơ inh gơh roi ăn kơ Kră Yang Tơ'ngla wơh inh noh thoi yơ.”

English: And David said to Gad, “I am in great distress. Please let us fall into the hand of the LORD, for His mercies are great; but do not let me fall into the hand of man.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit khan kơ Gat bơngai khan lê̆ adrol: “Inh hơwơ̆l hơwang dêh, inh anat kơ wă rơih. Kơtrơ̆m lu bơ̆n jah huŏng lăm tơpang ti Kră Yang đĕch 'lơ̆ng hloh, yua kơ Sư đei tơdrong 'mêm mơnat tih dêh! Apinh Ih 'nĕ ăn kơ inh huŏng lăm ti kon bơngai!

English: So the LORD sent a plague upon Israel from the morning till the appointed time. From Dan to Beersheba seventy thousand men of the people died.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang ăn tơdrong jĭ hơbuh jur tơ kon pơlei Isơrael đơ̆ng pơgê năr noh truh tơ tôch jơ Sư pơkă. Đơ̆ng Đan truh tơ Bêrsêba, đei tơpơh-jĭt rơbâu 'nu bơngai lôch.

English: And when the angel stretched out His hand over Jerusalem to destroy it, the LORD relented from the destruction, and said to the angel who was destroying the people, “It is enough; now restrain your hand.” And the angel of the LORD was by the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng chro ti sư tơ gah pơlei Jêrusalem wă pơrăm lê̆ pơlei, mă-lei Kră Yang ưh pă wă pơmat lu sư dơ̆ng, na Sư khan kơ linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă oei pơrăm kon pơlei pơla: “Tôm boih! Dui ti ih brŏk bĕ!” Kơplah noh linh jang 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang oei 'bơ̆t dơnih pơjuă 'ba, Arauna, bơngai Jêbus.

English: Then David spoke to the LORD when he saw the angel who was striking the people, and said, “Surely I have sinned, and I have done wickedly; but these sheep, what have they done? Let Your hand, I pray, be against me and against my father’s house.”
Bahnar: Lăp pơtao Đawit 'bôh linh jang 'lơ̆ng pơlôch pơrăm kon pơlei pơla, na pơtao apinh Kră Yang khan: “Inh boih mă bơngai yoch, inh boih mă bơngai glăi dêh! Na mă lu kon triu 'nâu lu sư ưh kơ đei pơm tơdrong kiơ ôh? Apinh ti Kră Yang pơrăm inh hăm 'nhŏng oh hnam 'bă inh đĕch.”

English: And Gad came that day to David and said to him, “Go up, erect an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.”
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Gat bơngai khan lê̆ adrol năm khan kơ pơtao Đawit: “Apinh pơtao năm truh tơ dơnih pơjuă 'ba Arauna bơngai Jêbus păng tơiung pơdơ̆ng 'bơ̆t doh minh pôm chơnang soi kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.”

English: So David, according to the word of Gad, went up as the LORD commanded.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit năm hloi kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Gat bơngai khan lê̆ adrol tơ'bôh thoi Kră Yang đei bơtho pơkă ăn kơ sư.

English: Now Araunah looked, and saw the king and his servants coming toward him. So Araunah went out and bowed before the king with his face to the ground.
Bahnar: Arauna ngơk lăng 'bôh pơtao păng đĭch đam sư năm adrol kơ sư, na sư năm lĕch tơkan kŭp kơ̆l drap muh măt tơ teh, kơkuh kơ pơtao.

English: Then Araunah said, “Why has my lord the king come to his servant?” And David said, “To buy the threshing floor from you, to build an altar to the LORD, that the plague may be withdrawn from the people.”
Bahnar: Arauna khan: “Ơ pơtao yŏng tơ'ngla inh, năm tơ'bơ̆p đĭch đam hăm đei tơdrong kiơ wă bơtho tơ'bôh ưh?” Pơtao Đawit tơl khan: “Inh năm răt dơnih pơjuă 'ba ih. Inh wă tơiung pơdơ̆ng chơnang soi kơkuh 'bơ̆t anih âu. Wă kơkuh kơ Kră Yang păng wă kơ tơdrong jĭ hơbuh âu pơdơh ưh pă pơrăm kon pơlei pơla dơ̆ng.”

English: Now Araunah said to David, “Let my lord the king take and offer up whatever seems good to him. Look, here are oxen for burnt sacrifice, and threshing implements and the yokes of the oxen for wood.
Bahnar: Arauna tơl pơtao Đawit: “Apinh pơtao yŏng tơ'ngla inh mơ̆ng kơ ih wă yua dơnih pơjuă 'ba 'nâu păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kiơ̆ kơ pơtao tơchĕng 'nâu đei boih rơmo wă pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi 'buh, kư̆m đei gơ'bang pơjuă 'ba păng 'long ăt rơmo wă pơm 'long ŭnh.

English: All these, O king, Araunah has given to the king.” And Araunah said to the king, “May the LORD your God accept you.”
Bahnar: Ơ pơtao! Arauna apinh pơyơ̆r ăn kơ pơtao đĭ-đăng tơmam noh.” Arauna tơl dơ̆ng: “Apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơtao tơl tơwih nơ̆r pơtao.”

English: Then the king said to Araunah, “No, but I will surely buy it from you for a price; nor will I offer burnt offerings to the LORD my God with that which costs me nothing.” So David bought the threshing floor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao tơl khan: “Ưh kơ gơh. Inh wă răt păng ăn kơ ih jên tôm, inh ưh kơ wă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh lu tơmam soi 'buh, mă inh ưh kơ đei hiong jên răt.” Na pơtao Đawit răt dơnih noh păng rơmo noh dang tơdrâu tơpei hu.

English: And David built there an altar to the LORD, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. So the LORD heeded the prayers for the land, and the plague was withdrawn from Israel.
Bahnar: Đawit pơm minh pôm chơnang soi kơkuh, wă kơkuh kơ Kră Yang, pơtao pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang tơmam soi 'buh. Păng tơmam soi hiôk-hian. Kră Yang tơl tơwih nơ̆r pơtao krao apinh ăn kơ teh đak, păng tơdrong jĭ hơbuh pơdơh ưh pă pơrăm kon pơlei Isơrael dơ̆ng.
